description: Way better to walk the 10min from Fishermans Wharf to this AMAZING spot! Small, cute, simple, but with amazing food and at fair prices
author: Monica R.

description:
I really wanted to adore this cafe because by the looks of the exterior, it looks like such a posh neighborhood cafe that I can see myself supporting. While the staff here is nice and they offer a decent selection of breakfast and lunch options, the execution left me unimpressed. 

I ordered the egg and cheese bagel which has egg, melty cheese, and roma tomato encapsulated in a plain bagel. Sounds tasty enough--I've had a million bagel sandwiches in my lifetime and expected this one to be decent like the rest.

My sandwich looked really sad! It was the thinnest bagel sandwich, the egg was super flat and the cheese barely melty. The tomato wasn't roma. I had to ask for Tapatio to douse my sandwich.

The Cafe Nutella also left me unimpressed. I wish it would have had a more velvetty nutty flavor but it was flat. The iced chai here however is frothy creamy and delicious!

The breakfast parfait was decent but for that price I could go to Safeway down the street and make my own. I'm all about supporting local small businesses so I'll give them a try again so long as the offerings don't look like something I could whip up myself.
author: Connie M.

description:
I always pass by this cute corner cafe on the way to Trader Joe's. There are always people sitting outside enjoying the sunshine, and I told myself I would eat here and enjoy myself the same next time. I came here famished, right before it was going to close at 4 pm, and got myself a turkey avocado panini. For $12, I was expecting more substance in between my bread. There was one slice of lettuce, two tinyyyyy slices of avocado, and a maybe two thin slices of turkey... I felt like I was just eating thick toasted bread because the ratio of bread to filings was 3:1.  

Maybe resources were low right before closing time, but for $12, I could've gone to Trader Joe's and gotten something much more substantial.
author: Vickie Z.

description: Such a gem! The oatmeal is to die for the the orange juice is fresh squeezed on the spot. Coffee was delish. I would go back here when in town 100 times.
author: Erinn F.

description: Cute spot, but very overpriced. I got a bacon, egg, and cheese on a bagel that was over $6. It was small and you could barely taste the ingredients.
author: Michelle B.

description:
Wow just had one of the worst experiences in 20 years in SF .  Went to this cafe, ordered a bagel which was fine and then decided to take a Caprese salad to go for work.  Luckily I peaked into the box before I left as I was shocked that this was nothing like a caprese salad.  (Oh and its an 'italian cafe no less) . It was a bunch of mixed greens, mini cubes of cheap mozzarella, no tomatoes.  I thought they made a mistake!  when I went to the counter i was told, no that's the salad and the tomatoes were the rinds they obviously cut off for sandwiches etc.   I look at the menu description to make sure I wasn't mad and its says Mozzarella, tomato, basil and balsamic.  when I pointed this out they said 'yeah we don't have all the ingredients" .  I said then take it off the menu! and wait for it, they threatened to call the police!!!  I'm dying LOL!!

Maybe they thought I was another idiot tourist, but locals beware!!
author: Maureen M.

description:
I'd go so far as to say that this is one of those little cafes that truly fits its location perfectly.  Cafe Capriccio is a nice little spot on the corner of a not particularly famous North Beach corner.  It is not a destination, and I think that this probably worked in its favor.  The result is a nice little cafe which is not jumping off the hook.  The things here are just fine.  And, they don't force a contrived environment - it's already good enough to be on a nice corner of North Beach, with decent Sandwiches, Coffee, Wraps, Quiche and Breakfast items.  Nice chill spot inside and a few tables outside.

I've had lunch here a number of times - and I like their sandwiches.  It takes a few minutes, but the ingredients are tasty and it comes on grilled bread and with a nice little salad.  Says a Minnesotan:  "I guess that's what they call a Panini."  ... I didn't grow up in North Beach, but I like good Prosciutto, Mozzarella, Basil, Olive Oil, etc. I like a chill place to have a cup of coffee in the morning.  BTW - They also have Iced Coffee, which is reasonably priced and packs a good pre-work punch.  

I'll keep going back when it's convenient.  This place isn't going to become a scene so I feel comfortable recommending if you like the things that I just outlined,  I hope you drop by and enjoy it as much as I have.  I root for all good businesses to succeed, but I hope this place stays low-key.  They do a solid job.
author: Adam S.

description: This little gem is definitely worth a stop for breakfast or lunch. The vanilla latte was the best cup served during our stay in California. My husband and I enjoyed breakfast twice at this establishment. Pastries are fresh and delicious!
author: Quella R.

description: One of 6 places I can go, within a few blocks, for coffee and a bagel.  I stopped going for awhile as the coffee, in a self-serve canister, was so thick with grounds...I don't think the staff actually drinks coffee. So I stopped going a year ago and decided to give it a shot today...I wanted a toasted bagel with cream cheese and tomato. Another fail... they put the bagel in a panini with cream cheese and tomato.... some weird cream cheese too. The bagel is crushed... don't believe the photo of this place. Imagine the bagel stepped on by Sasquatch.  And the cheese tastes "off."I want to support my local business but I'm lucky I have other places to go to.
author: Sandra H.

description: A simple but delicious cafe with friendly service and amazing coffee and espresso drinks. Cozy, clean, and fast. Great location in North Beach with indoor and outside seating. Try the croissants! Small menu, but everything is done fresh and to order.
author: John M.

description: Nice unpretentious neighborhood spot to while away a couple hours over excellent coffee and a good book.  I've only tried the citrus cake, which was quite good and will return for a quiche or bagel lunch next week.
author: Donna P.

description:
Went here in the afternoon an hour before close. I ordered the California Turkey Panini, and when it arrived, it had completely different ingredients than I thought it would. It added in tomatoes that wasn't on the menu, which, if I had an allergy, could be dangerous. The arugula was substituted out for lettuce, which I was not notified of. 

When I went to ask the man behind the counter why the ingredients were different, he immediately got defensive and said that's the way they've been making sandwiches for the past few years. He acted as if I was the crazy one for not receiving the sandwich I ordered. Like, sure, I'm fine with the changes, but change your menu to be accurate and tell customers if you're making a substitution. It just seemed irresponsible and rude.
author: Teresa I.

description:
I was on an extensive hunt for the best coffee in SF as well as the best patisserie/boulangerie. Though I don't think I found THE best, I must say their baristas are AMAZING but their food is just ok, ambience is casual and warm. Overall, I would go back if I am in the area, but I didn't fall in love with it. 

First, we got a mocha and a hot chocolate. Take it from a barista with 10 years experience when I say you can't really mess up a hot chocolate, it was still perfectly balanced between sweet tasting, foam, and delicious cocoa (I think it is a sauce not a powder, fyi). As for the mocha, excellent. The foam was sweet and delicious with just under a half inches worth - perfect. They did some latte art as well, which I have NEVER been able to do - try as I might. The mocha was perfectly balanced with the richness of the espresso. The espresso itself was full bodied but not over powering, not too acidic, and very aromatic. Whatever their blend is, I appreciated. 

Food wise, I think the quality of the breakfast sandwiches I got were ok. Nothing to brag about. I was starving and just wanted something so I wouldn't be hangry anymore. I must say, their lunch menu looked more to be desired than breakfast - they also seemed to be lacking in the pastry/bread department but we got their around 10 so it could have been taken by the morning rush. I would be interested to try some of their lunch sandwiches and paninis.

Finally, the location wasn't too bad. It was only two or three blocks away from Hotel Zephr (our hotel, go check out my review!!). So essentially 3-4 blocks away from the piers. 

I will definitely go back for coffee, skip it if you want something spectacular for food. I just try to support local businesses over chain places. I will still be on the look out for the best coffee place (the one I looked at was closed for renos). Honestly, the mocha sold me. Consistent? Not sure since I have only been here once.
author: Rebecca A.

description: "F" Starbuck and his handsomer but still soulless corporate cousin Peet.  No thank you Philz arrogant gimmicky overpriced overhyped and lame.  Four Barrel etc blah blah blah yuppie carpetbagger screenpoople lemmingfolk go home back to elsewhere and stay there please thank you very much.  BEST coffee in the North Beach NEIGHBORHOOD place REAL people and how can you go wrong it's owned by a LOCAL siculo-americano of multi super generational NORTH BEACH original family bloodline.  Jesus Rogelio and co. are SOLID and the coffee is DELICIOUS hot strong good I love it almost daily.
author: Michael G.

description: The food was excellent. We loved everything we ordered. The food was fresh and very tasty. We had cappuccinos, strawberry pies, roasted chicken panini and salad, fruit parfait, muffins, smoked salmon bagels and egg and bacon bagels.
author: Edwin M.

description: What a delightful little family run neighborhood place. Great lattes etc, and really good panini at prices well below the going rate here these beat and evil tech days. Extremely friendly vibe, a few small tables inside, with a few more outside facing in the right directions to catch a little sunshine -south and west. Just a nice, quiet cafe to hang out as an alternative to the sometimes too buzzy heart of north beach.
author: stephen h.

description:
05.14.16

Super low key neighborhoody cafe. The quiche is delicious and hearty. I'd pass on the iced tea, though.

Total damage: $11.44
author: Jenny L.

description:
I was strolling from China town toward the water and spied this corner purveyor of coffee drinks, sweets and wi-fi and decided to give it a go if only for a double espresso and cantuccini, and a very well situated outside chair that provided sun and a view of all passersby.

Cafe Cappriccio serves a lovely double espresso.

The wait staff were attentive and relaxed.

And the decor to this lovely little corner cafe called back to a day when in fact a wash cost only 20¢ and a dry could be had for a dime as advertised on window across from my very well situated outside chair that provided sun and a view of all passersby.

I will return. Oh, I will return.
author: Jay D.

description:
I absolutely enjoyed my visit. What I experienced was the heart of local business all throughout the world. This place, my fellow Yelpers, is worth a visit.

It's a few blocks from the touristy piers. It's located on a corner in a nice neighborhood. Bring your laptop or tablet. Bring a friend. Stay a while. Sit inside or grab a seat outside and sunbathe. There's wifi with no password.

I only had a blueberry cheese danish and an iced mocha. Both were hits. If you know me well, then you know cheese danishes are a weakness of mine. This danish was amazing. My iced mocha had enough sweetness without an overpowering sugar taste.

What really made my visit here so memorable was how friendly the staff was. I started off sitting outside in the shade and they brought my food to me. I was a bit cold so I moved inside and I saw how friendly everyone was with every person that walked through their doors. I could have easily picked up and gone somewhere else to kill time (I was on my laptop) but I felt so at home at this cafe. I ended up staying for about three hours.

Kudos to this great place. I'll definitely be back in July for another danish!
author: Xerxes N.

description: Little corner coffee shop serving up a quaint breakfast and cappuccino on a wintery SF day. Great retro decor. Comfortable seating for a family of four. My daughter inhaled her fruit parfait while the boy laboured over his jelly croissant. Coffees were above average for the US... overall warm and cosy bfast with good prices for SF.
author: Mel L.

description: They serve good coffee. It's quiet and clean; decent prices too. I stopped frequenting Starbucks since moving to the city and been trying to support local coffee shops and this is one of my favorites. Spent an hour sipping coffee and reading a book.
author: D L.

description:
Great cafe. Very nicely decorated, the staff is super nice, coffee and food are great, and it is cheaper and not as touristic compared to the cafes on columbus. 
If you happen to be in North Beach, I definitely recommend this cafe.
author: Giulio P.

description: Ok. I tried to give this place another shot. It's a family owned business so I do my best to support. But when everyone get their order first after they order behind me and I have I go in and get my bagel, that's unacceptable. People had their orders delivered to them and I had to go pick up my cold egg bagel.
author: Henry W.

description: I am visiting San Francisco and found this gem. This shop is very clean and the food is amazing. I got the chai tea which was very creamy and delicious. The lox and bagel were fresh and had an amazing taste. Everything was made fresh to each order. The staff was very friendly and welcoming to us. I will be returning and will recommend this to everyone who visits this cute city.
author: Alicia L.

description:
Totally mediocre breakfast. Maybe more interesting for drinks rather than food? 

Got a croissant sandwich and a bagel sandwich. Both incredibly basic, flavorless. American cheese. 

Big pass on this place. Nothing wrong with service or location. It's all the horrible food.
author: Ryan B.

description: I fully intended to order the blueberry muffin! Somehow I ended up all healthy with the fruit/ yogurt parfait. I don't regret it. The lady chopped the fresh fruit and built my parfait after I ordered it. It was fresh and tasty. A perfect start to a day of sight-seeing.
author: Sandy J.

description:
**Use the Yelp check-in deal! ($15 for $10)**

I've never roasted an establishment based on service-- I'm more into the food, value, and atmosphere. Seriously. Ugh! There's a first for everything I guess!

Before I even placed my order I was barked at by the barista. Two young ladies lined up to place an order behind me and all three of us were scolded because we weren't standing close enough to the counter. Thankfully the young man that took my order was friendly and pleasant. I grabbed my number and made my way to a table outside to enjoy he amazing San Fran sunny weather. 

A few minutes passed and the crabby barista came out with my cappuccino. Again, she scolded me! She made some snide comment about how my coffee was probably cold because she was calling my number for awhile now. Um, you didn't think to go outside?!? It's not like this place is big or anything! The two young ladies that ordered behind me were now sitting at the table next to me, so they witnessed both of my scoldings. All three of us chuckled at how bizarre the barista's crappy attitude was and joked that she must be having a bad day. (On a side note, several yelp reviews mention this barista and her crappy attitude, so I doubt it was an off day) They decided that they didn't want to get yelled at by the barista so one of them went inside to pick up their drinks. 

Anyway, the coffee is excellent and the food is pretty good! The outdoor seating is great along the streets of this quiet part of North Beach. 

5 stars for food and coffee, 2 stars for service (the order-taker guy was friendly). Also, props for free wifi so I could sit outside and type up this review on my iPad!)
author: Andrea H.

description: Excellent coffee.  Oatmeal bowel with fresh sliced fruit. Good atmosphere. My review is short and sweet....if I had complaints it would be easier to fill this page. But I don't and highly recommend this place if you are in san fran.
author: Joshua K.

description: Would seem to be a candidate for neighborhood watering hole - witness the historical b&w photos filling the walls - but the hours are too truncated to foster much of a following. The (breakfast) menu was varied but how can you top healthy oatmeal with fresh fruit? I wasn't surprised that it was pre-measured  out-of-the-bag fare; I've used that myself occasionally but with milk, not water and this was water and watery. The capp had a nice rosette but tasted slightly burnt. Pass.
author: Bruce B.

description: Awesome coffee and breakfast. They actually make the eggs rather than microwaving them for the bagel sandwiches!
author: Matthew S.

description:
Doesn't feel as welcoming- no music, kinda quiet, prices are a little higher than expected and a small menu, but it keeps in the theme of awesome little cafe's in this area. I mean I wish I could yelp this area because I stayed in SF for a week and every day I had a different place to manja at. And even though this place was not my favorite - I still would come here every week as a regular rotation of places to eat at. 

Overall around here it's not my fave, but in the grand scheme - it's still a tasty little joint.

Enjoy.
author: Kevin P.

description:
Cafe Capriccio was your ideal french cozy cafe'. Its a corner shop in the middle of a nostalgic San Fran neighborhood. 

Small tables held up the walls with the coffee bar dominating the room. INstead of the traditioning cakes and pastries, the staff had a selection of quiche in the cooler. I chose the Mexican flavor as my wife chose the Pesto. Both were delicious. Further, the coffee was life changing. 

Maybe it was the gloomy weather or the neighborhood patrons coming in and out; either way it was perfect. 

We will be back.
author: Alecks R.

description: Very friendly service and helpful staff. A nice outside seating area. Good oatmeal, they cooked it to order for us. Served with nuts, raisins, and brown sugar. Also got some delicious fresh squeezed orange juice.
author: Quinna H.

description:
We wanted to sit down for a cup off coffee walking away from pier 39 and walking towards Chinatown we found this small coffee shop, which is hard now to find

Wonderful service and nice variety of coffee and espresso.
author: Mariel F.

description:
A really nice café, just on the other corner across from our hotel. 
Good service. A nice breakfast; granola with yoghurt and fresh fruit. Coffee is strong and good.
author: Stefanie G.

description:
Despite its name, it's not really an italian cafe. Service was a bit on the curt side, and drinks were just okay (and not Italian-style). We came here to try ordering coffees with the new Cups app, and were first told that we couldn't get a large size (untrue; we showed them the description within the app) and then had to pay extra for a dirty chai latte, which should have been included as a standard drink. 

Wifi was good, and there's ample space to work, but probably won't return again.
author: Michelle A.

description: The staff is very nice. But the food isn't what i thought it was. But a very small and wonderful place to go.
author: Braxton L.

description:
TL;DR: I had one tiny slice of ham on my ham and cheese bagel, and they were out of two things I wanted.

This place was pretty disappointing considering its rating. Traveling here from Portland I was looking for a good breakfast sandwich and coffee to have fuel for walking around.  Ordered a chai, they're out. Okay no big. I'll take a latte. Ordered a ham and cheese croissant, no croissants. Hm okay. I'll take a ham and cheese bagel.

There was A slice of processed ham on my bagel with cheese that was barely toasted. Like one. The funny thing is I was charged the full 5.95 for a ham and cheese croissant. Also on their menu if you were to add ham or bacon to any other sandwich it's $1.50! I'll be walking straight to the pier for a cup of clam chowder 

I swear I'm not hard to please, this girl just wants a little protein! 

To end this on a positive note and what earned them a third star: their vanilla latte was delicious and really well made.
author: Larissa S.

description:
I wouldn't say there is anything wrong with this place, but there is definitely  better food and ambience out there, especially since North Beach is such a cute area. Cafe capriccio is on a random street corner with not much going on. If you walk up to Washington Square Park area, there are a lot cuter restaurants. The outdoor seating at Cafe Capriccio nice, but then again, there are a lot of places in North Beach with outdoor seating. It's relatively reasonably priced, but I would rather spend a few extra dollars and get better food in a more attractive location. 

Foodwise, I had the caprese sandwich which wasn't bad, but I've had better. All in all, I wouldn't recommend this to a friend, but if there no other options, it's not terrible.
author: Jenna G.

description: I live in the area and decided to try this place with a friend who was visiting. I ordered a tomato bagel which was mediocre. Maybe the bagel was old. My friend had a gluten free diet and combined two breakfast items to accommodate this restriction. She paid $18 for eggs with processed American cheese, side of lox and a small salad. The eggs were so bad with the processed cheese that she asked if they had any other cheese they could substitute. The staff didn't care and just reaffirmed that it was real cheese. If you've ever slapped a Kraft single on top of eggs, this is what my friend got. I'm writing this place off as a tourist trap for everyone staying in Fisherman's Wharf.
author: Jared B.

description:
Perfect coffee and espressos. 
We stopped here on the way to touring Alcatraz. The egg wrap is large enough for two small portions. Bagel with egg and tomato, and ham & cheese croissant are excellent.  Priced reasonably. 
Great quiet atmosphere, lovely neighborhood at 7:30 in the morning. 
Parking is what is is. 
Worth going off the beaten path.
author: Melody P.

description: This place is just the go-to spot for a solid latte and perhaps a breakfast bagel. Friendly and fast service--this place makes you feel like home. If you want a quick coffee or a bite to eat, you won't be disappointed!
author: K M.

description:
A hidden gem on the corner for coffee and tea aficionados with the bonus of great snacks and dishes.  Some highlights include their African red bush tea and chocolate or almond croissants as well as the fig, ricotta and proscuitto bruschetta.  It's a great place to chat outside or indoors as well as get some work done.  Several parents chill here before picking up kids from the pre-school across the street.  

Service is fast, friendly and helpful.  The decor is simple and clean with ample seating for hanging out.  Parking is on the street.
author: Jenny L.

description: Living a few blocks away from this place, I've obviously visited more because it's close by. But that doesn't mean it's bad -- definitely a nice place to study/read with free wifi and always a spot available. Haven't tried their food items, but the lattes are definitely worth getting
author: Mingmei N.

description:
One of the many many great cafes in the north beach. What Capriccio has going for it is that it is actually pretty far away from most of the other cafes in little italy in north beach. You feel like you are getting far from the maddening crowd when you check out this little place on Mason street. 

The drinks were excellent and I was always impressed by the food. The wraps were large and always tasty and came with a salad for a nice filling lunch. The drinks can be a pit pricey but its worth dropping 15 bucks to go to a quiet area and work and not be bothered by a ton of people coming in and out like you see and many cafes in north beach. 

I especially liked the work area in Capriccio. The wifi was strong and the seating was comfortable. They have a large couch area in the back with pillows and plenty of outside seating to enjoy the rare sight of sun in the area.
author: Nick R.

description:
Enjoyed an excellent cappuccino, very good egg and cheese wrap with bacon,  and they topped it off with friendly prompt service. 
Can't ask for more than that for breakfast.!
author: Matt G.

description:
Stopped by the cafe on Sunday morning and had one of the best soy cappuccinos I've ever had (although I usually get my coffee black, weird).  I felt like this adorable cafe probably made amazing drinks and I was NOT disappointed (although ordered with an extra shot of espresso..so I may have been caffeine drunk..).  I got the yogurt parfait to eat and the granola was crunchy and there were BANANAS!!!! I hate places that give you all the fruit no one wants (melons I'm looking at you). 

I can't wait to come back for lunch since the paninis & sandwiches looked delish! The guys who were working were extremely friendly and would be a welcome inclusion to my weekend routine :)
author: Raina D.

description: Love, love, love this cute small coffee shop in the corner of Chestnut and Mason. Decent French press coffee for $3 for a big fat mug, and their breakfast bagels. I came from Washington, so, their prices which I'm sure of San Franciscan are cheap, for me, a bit much. But, when the food came, I can see why. Generous. Nice and friendly people too, and in a quiet neighborhood. It was a perfect start of a sunny day in the city!
author: Daisy S.

description: A very nice and cozy place. Had fantastic latte and cappuccino along with amazing bagel sandwiches (smoked salmon with a bit of Sriracha was awesome). Enjoyed having breakfast here.
author: Aliya V.

description: Customer service is extremely lacking.  Went in to order and it took 6 minutes for anyone to acknowledge my presence.   When I flagged down the cashier, he indicated he is very busy right now and couldn't help take my order. ........?????  Never heard such a thing in my life.   Besides that the oatmeal came out cold and egg croissant was stale.   Upon asking for Gerardo the manager , he was nowhere to be found and no one else was in charge.   Horrible place, horrible food,  horrible experience.   Will never be back.
author: Dan C.

description: This place has the worst customer service ever. I tried to place a delivery order but had some issues online. They told me to call Eat24 and hung up on me. When I called back to clarify some things, the woman was extremely rude to me. If I'm going to get this kind of service, I'm going to go somewhere else.
author: E C.

description:
My favorite place to hang out and relax before picking up my kids.
Prosciutto di Parma on Dutch crunch is my favorite and it comes with a side salad too
They ran out of soy milk for my Chai tea that day but I ended up trying it with almond milk and it was surprisingly delicious.. 
Staff and owner are super nice..
Atmosphere and neighborhood is nice and quiet..
author: Lor L.

description:
What a cozy, mellow cafe shop right at the center of a residential neighborhood of North Beach!

Somewhat hipster ambiance with their cushioned wall seats!  I like!

With the pouring rain outside, warm cup of cappuccino, comfortable seats and complimentary Wi-Fi, I was lingering here for some hours!

They provide a stamp card - for the 10th cup of coffee, it will be on the house!

It is definitely a low key cafe shop and that makes it a great place to be at just because it truly provides a time for oneself to be concentrating on stuff to do!
author: Tiffany D.

description:
Food: Delicious. Blueberry pie made from scratch with real blueberries. 
Coffee: The real deal -- French Press, full of flavor.
Service: Staff was extremely friendly and helpful when I needed to ask about ingredients due to a food allergy.
Speed: The only place a star was lost. They're making everything for you (no pre-packaged junk), so it's understandable, it would just be a deal breaker on a work day when I needed to get somewhere quickly.
author: Carlene G.

description: Great experience! The gentleman making my breakfast bagel was friendly (haven't eaten it yet but I'm sure it will be delicious) and the cashier who made my iced mocha was also friendly and helpful. The mocha was fantastic-I prefer a less sweet chocolate. At other cafes I order half chocolate. I'm glad I didn't. Soo good. What I LOVED- the cashier washed her hands after taking my cash before she made my drink. I saw her do the same with the next customer who paid by card. That ensure I will be a repeat customer!
author: Mandi L.

description: Upon being immediately seated with my family of 6 we never received water asked for our order or even awknowleged as 6 waiters walked passed us and stood around. After 15 minutes of being ignored we walked out!
author: Summer R.

description:
This is the neighborhood go-to spot for breakfast bagel sandwiches on a Saturday morning.  I love the neighborhood vibe here.  Plus, it is a really relaxed and cozy spot to dip in on a crisp SF morning.  Depending on your mood, you can appreciate its coziness over Francisco Cafe (preferable if you feel like having more light and space) and quieter than Columbus Cafe (preferable if you want a whole plethora of drink options and watching America's Cup on TV).      

The ham and cheese croissant sandwich is very filling.  Also, the lox sandwich was fresh, which is a nice surprise, considering this is not a NY bagel store.  I also like their soup and quiche.  However, the blueberry pie was a bit tart for my taste, but that's OK...  should cut back on sweets, anyway.  Chai tea and coffee come in big mugs, which I appreciate.      

I love it here!  Everyone is really friendly, too.
author: Miran C.

description: I was visiting from Seattle and randomly found this place. The food was quick and reasonably priced and very good. It is a small place but there is outdoor seating. The coffee is good, but not as good as Seattle :) I would go here!
author: Jamie A.

description: It was okay. Food was nothing special, and we had to remind them to make our lattes. Our bagels were warmed , but not toasted, and there was only the thinnest layer of cream cheese. I wouldn't say no about returning if it was important to a friend, but I wouldn't go out of my way to go back .  Ambiance is very pleasant.
author: Mindy L.

description:
Nice little cafe, people were friendly. Unfortunately the food was not good. 

We ordered the egg and cheese bagel and the California turkey panini. The egg was not fresh, the bagel was a little stale. The panini was unlike any panini I've ever had. The bread had the panini lines on it, but somehow remained untoasted, highlighted by the fact that the cheese was unmelted. We ended up leaving and grabbing more food elsewhere.

Maybe it was just a bad day or we ordered the wrong things, but would not recommend
author: Bob J.

description:
What an adorable little cafe!! We came here to read and get some brunch on Sunday and this place totally won me over. We shared the chicken and caprese panini and I also got a latte. 

The latte was rich and super frothy. The coffee flavor was pretty intense and they put a heart design on the foam :). Our sandwiches were also delicious!! The caprese won by a nose, we both thought. The bread were nice and crunchy without being oily and the amount of pesto was just right. The mozzarella was fresh and the tomatoes juicy. The chicken sandwich had crunchy pieces of red onion, which gave it a zing, and the chicken was moist. I would probably ask for no-hummus next time, though. 

Another great thing about the sandwiches were the side salad that came with it. It was very fresh and tangy. I think it's probably one of the best salads that I've had. Simple, nothing complicated. Very San Francisco.
author: Alice W.

description: If you think this is a cute Italian cafe, think again. Very little is Italian on the menu. So I ordered a ham and cheese croissant...it was made with American cheese, maybe even velveeta! Gross.
author: Danielle L.

description:
The best espresso I've ever had. Not kidding. Cafe Capriccio also (and not surprisingly) makes an amazing Americano, which I'm embarrassed to admit may be my favorite type of coffee these days. There's is so flavorful and delicious I think I may be forever spoiled.

I've now been here multiple times, and am able to report that the food is delicious as well. They make a delicious roast beef and cheese panini made with a thick baguette bread that kept me full all day; the vegetarian caprese sandwich is also great. They serve it up with thick slices of mozzarella, tomato, and pesto sauce with a side salad, and I was sad when it was gone. I may have even licked my fingers. My friend tried the quiche - a bold move, since it's such a hit-or-miss kind of dish - but we both agreed that it was cheesy deliciousness.

The ambiance is casual and quiet; even when it's crowded, most people are on their computers. There's a larger table for groups, and outdoor seating is plentiful and lovely on sunny days. If you're in the 'hood and want to escape (or, even better, avoid) the hubbub of Fisherman's Wharf, put this cafe on your list.
author: Ray J.

description:
Came here because of the good reviews on the coffee and its coupon deal. $10 for $15. The cafe staff's service/friendliness varies. Had one with less than average attitude, and one (Asian guy) who were very helpful and friendly. The attitude was quite a contrast. 

My friends and I ordered 2 lattes and 2 berry pie. The coffee was okay, the pie was made locally, a bit on the tart side which i'm guessing because they didn't load it with excess sugar, which i liked. They got one of the lattes wrong, the nicer staff easily replaced it with a new one. 
I was expecting quite a bit from the good reviews, but one of the staff there let a star down.
author: Lianne M.

description: Wonderful place! Great breakfasts. Great service. Warm atmosphere and soft music. Love this place!
author: Niklas M.

description:
They say, Home is where the Heart is. Well it's more like Home is where the Capprichio is. 

Around the corner from it's competitors, Capriccio is that hidden treasure in North Beach that brightens your day at any time between 6-7pm Monday-Sunday. Can't help you after hours, sorry that's when you call a therapist for your problems.

A crew of multi-ethnic, multi faceted peeps that run the show, always chill and always upbeat. Out door seating if you wanna kick in some vitamin D on a sunny day, out door seating if u cant afford a shower on a rainy day. Excellent for studying, or reading, with the assistance of free wifi.

I've been a regular at this cafe for about 2 years for my cup a joe, but it's there Lattes that bring the real shine. I've been so addicted that my cards have been stamped up over and over. 10 star stamps and I'm ordering a FREE large latte with 9 shots pimpskillet, like fiddy cent would!
author: Sani S.

description:
Fantastic!

Wandering around too early on Sunday morning and looking for somewhere to rest, we saw this cafe and popped in for a latte and chocolate croissant.  

Cozy, neighborhood shop with tables out front to enjoy your beverage and pastry.  Perfectly charming!
author: Jessica J.

description:
Decent enough. Good wifi, pretty good breakfast. A bit of a snooty attitude toward customers. I am sorry that I don't know your rules about not being able to carry something out if it was missing from a table. There is a nicer way to let me know then to say you have other things to do inside. 

Otherwise everything was fine.
author: Gosha K.

description: First time here and definitely not the last!! The workers are very friendly. The food is really fresh and yummy. I ordered the hummus plate and it was SO delicious! Plus, free WiFi!! 10/10 recommend :)
author: Rachel K.

description: Incredible people, great food. Was going for Mama's and ended up finding this palace. Great spot, dudes. You gotta check it out - don't forget to order the hot chocolate and the egg wrap - very nice.
author: Bruno S.

description:
Nice cafe....  located at a corner

Like most cafe the place is small... not a lot of seating... not much standing room either....

Good selection of food... large menu... lots of drinks

Good portion size... good price... nice staffer..... clean place to eat
author: Kevin J.

description:
Cafe Capriccio makes the BEST chai latte I've ever had, and they do it consistently. It keeps me coming back at least once a week. Which is why it pains me to give them fewer than 5 stars.

Their normal operating hours are until 6pm every day except Tuesday, when they close slightly earlier. For the past month, I've come in the afternoon on at least 5 occasions to find them closed early. As far as I can tell there's no pattern to this, and their hours on the door still say they close at 6. So it's very frustrating and a waste of my time when I arrive at 4:30pm, as I did today, and find it closed early.

I'd have no problem if this was an emergency once-in-a-while thing, but it's clearly not, and they haven't updated their business hours to reflect that. So, Yelpers, if you're considering coming by past lunchtime, you'll be taking a chance.
author: Justin S.

description: The man taking our orders had no idea what we ordered when we asked. They were closing, but instead of telling us, they forced us to sit outside instead. The food was bland and frankly pretty bad.
author: Dana L.

description: I don't know how they do it but their chai is like none other. Super smooth, not necessarily very spicy I would say, but really nice. Their whole menu is also priced much better than the more prominently located cafes nearby, too.
author: Audrey S.

description: Bad food and way over priced. They microwave everything and have no selection. Don't waste your time.
author: Maria F.

description: This was the first time I have walked out of a place after having only two bites of the meal. The coffee was ok but the food was terrible. The panini was cold by the time I got it and the salad was made up of wilted spinach and refrigerated tomatoes. On top of that it took them 20 minutes to make even though they had very few customers.
author: Roko K.

description: Pretty standard menu. As for our meals, I was neither impressed or disappointed. Fairly expensive considering the simplicity of the menu-- could be due to location. Our ham and cheese croissant tasted like it had been nuked in a microwave, but they were willing to make a dish for me that isn't on their menu, so they definitely won me over with that
author: Stella M.

description:
Attention coffee shops! Offer your Americano in 8 oz/extra small cups! ESPECIALLY if you already have the cups in stock! Every good coffee shop (Reveille, Coffee Bar, Trieste, Beacon, Blue Bottle, Coffee Cultures, every cafe outside the US...) will give you this option, because this ratio of espresso to water is much stronger/better. 

Tried to order Americano here in 8 oz cup (stacked next to register), even though paying for 12 oz. Guy/manager confirms and says no problem. I remind barista (and point to cup) bc it took awhile to get to my drinks. She also says no problem. But then starts making drink in 12 oz cup? I ask her to stop, but she says "Look at the menu. An Americano only comes in a 12 oz" and hands me a drink filled to the brim. Huh? Just use less water? I know it all sounds trivial, and it's not like I didn't drink it, but I just get irritated when people blindly follow procedures without thinking, and are rude in the process.

Bumping this from 1 to 2 stars because the manager was really nice. I stupidly spilled a second drink I had ordered all over the sidewalk, and he offered to give me a replacement. I thanked him, but said I didn't have time (it took 20 minutes to get these two drinks!) and that I'd rather not order again from that barista. In the end though, I have too many other great coffee shops in my neighborhood to frequent this place again.
author: Alison S.

description:
Solid mocha and hummus. The chicken felt a little dry though. We went on a saturday for lunch and was not particularly crowded which I liked. The outdoor seating was perfect with Coit tower peeking from behind a neighborhood building. 

I will come here for the drinks but hit up other spots in the neighborhood for lunch.
author: Rahul H.

description: A nice cafe serving delicious panini and mimosa made with fresh squeezed orange juice. Had a beautiful afternoon at the patio area, a peaceful spot in North Beach.
author: Annie L.

description:
Pros: This little neighborhood cafe has great snacks and it's usually empty enough for the wifi to seem fast and for it to be quiet :)

Cons: The lighting is not that appropriate for working on the laptop for a long time, but you can easily fix that by sitting close to the windows!
author: Mariana F.

description:
Most reviewers (it seems) love this place for the coffee. We didn't have any, but, if we were to return, that is all that we would get, as the food was disappointing.

We stopped by for lunch on our way out of the city and ordered a pear, gorgonzola salad with chicken and a caprese panini as well as iced tea, a strawberry italian soda, and a water. The iced tea was freshly brewed, the italian soda tasted like soda water, and our water never arrived. When the food came out to the table, there was no chicken on the salad. We mentioned this to the gentleman who brought it. He disagreed before reluctantly taking the salad back to add chicken. It actually wasn't a bad dish, but the dressing was uneven - heavy in some bits, light in others. It was more the attitude of the server that bothered us. In terms of the sandwich, it was ok. Nothing unique or delicious.

I think Yelp best sums up our experience here with a, "Meh. I've experieneced better."
author: Kendall T.

description: Really satisfied with the service. The owner/baristas are friendly and easygoing.  I often order the nutella coffee which is like a mocha but stronger and cheaper. My only wish is that they would stay open after 3.
author: Di P.

description:
Brekki menu selection was pretty small and I definitely didn't see things on offer like some of what's shown in the pics within this place's Photo feed, mainly typical fare such as wraps, sandwiches, bagels, all very bread heavy.

Came here because of the pics and reviews of the coffee but was disappointed as there definitely wasn't the foam art (which to me, shows attention to detail) and my cappuccino was realllllllly sweet despite not asking for any sugars, perhaps it's the soy that they use?

I'll try Pat's cafe tmrw as its right around the corner and looks like it has potential.
author: Kevin A.

description:
I ordered the smoked salmon bagel and a hot chocolate.  The salmon was not good.  When I say "not good," I don't mean "didn't taste good," I mean the meat they used was rotten.  I had someone take a bite of it to make sure, and they agreed it was no good.  Also from the color of the meat, I could tell the fish was farmed...I don't know why any restaurant that resides in the bay would use farmed fish (farmed fish are full of antibiotics, pesticides, and disease from living in cramped pools).

The hot chocolate was really good though.  

Kind of pricey for such a weeny bagel, but the service was really good, so 2 stars.
author: Chelsea W.

description: Waited 15 min. for a bowl of fruit and bagel w/ cream cheese to go. Once we left, we were disappointed to discover that the bagel had no cream cheese. How do you forget the cream cheese?! The bowl of fruit was mainly apple slices with a few pieces of banana and strawberry.
author: Jordan R.

description: Best latte I ever had. Saw and heard all the hype about blue bottle but went here first.  I have to say after having 3 drinks at blue b then coming back the taste, texture and aroma is better for me here.  I would come here everyday if I lived here.
author: Chris N.

description: New management sucks. I ordered the egg wrap (tomato, egg, cheese and bacon). Not only were they out of tomatoes without telling me but they forgot to add the bacon. It costs extra to add bacon. This guy would have found a way to screw up yogurt and fruit.
author: Patrick S.

description:
I have had lunch at Cafe Capriccio twice. I love their salad - both quality and quantity.
Also their fresh squeezed orange juice is awesome!
author: Parminder Nayyar C.

description:
A tucked away neighborhood coffee shop that I cherish!
Good service and decent selection on the lunch menu.  And I love their location.  It's in the touristy part of the neighborhood but it's by the residential area so it's still quiet and it's not flooded with tourists like the other cafes.

On nice days like what we've lately, it's so nice to sit outside and have conversations with friends over coffee or wine.   (yes, they also serve wine!).
author: May W.

description:
Gerardo is the owner. Awesome guy and funny as hell. He will do whatever it takes to make sure you're happy with your order. I had a dirty chai latte with soy...yummmy. 
Other great things to mention: good work place with wifi. great location. Outdoor seating. clean bathroom!
author: Sasha S.

description:
Sorry- this review is for the Cafe Capriccio in Sacramento. Idk how to delete this review and re-post it to the correct place.

I would give this place 0 stars if I could. I placed a large order for a party and they didn't make half of it. They didn't apologize for leaving out half of the order. They offered to make the rest but it was going to take too much time. When I spoke to the owner about it the next day, all I wanted was an apology and reassurance that our next large order would be done right. She instead blamed me for ordering it incorrectly, when I specifically remember ordering the correct number AND calling to confirm the order the next day. She went on to cancel our next large order and tell me to never come back to Cafe Capriccio. I couldn't believe this is how they treat their customers. Why would I take time out of my day to call if I was the one who messed up the order? Obviously your staff made a mistake or there was a misunderstanding. She continued to blame me for it, saying that customers have to take responsibility and then hung up on me. Someone needs to teach this woman Business 101- listen to your customers and make the situation right if you messed up. Totally unbelievable. Really disappointed in this place. Will never go back.
author: Renu R.

description:
I wish I could put this place in my pocket and bring it back to MA with me. 

Before I get into any details, I'll preface this review with: I'm not from San Francisco. I'm from Boston, a place that has very few wine bars, so most of the wine bars I've been to are out of state. I've been to San Francisco a total of 3 times, Napa twice. I'm a wine lover. I'm a food lover. 

That being said...this is one of my favorite places in San Fran. We came across this neighborhood gem a couple days into our trip and stopped in 3 times before heading back home, twice on the same day. 

The staff is great, so friendly, welcoming, and knowledgeable about their wines. 
The food was delicious. We didn't try much more than breakfast and a snack, but the egg wrap, the oatmeal with fruit, the bagel sandwich, hot chocolate, and cheese plate were all good...
The seats are cozy. 
They have free wi-fi. 
They played great music every time we went. 
They have a wine bar. How many cafes do you know of with a wine bar? 
Their wines and wine flights are priced right and their selections are really good.
Not to mention that the $9 wine flight essentially gets you 3 full glasses of wine...or maybe we just lucked out. Either way, I love this place!  

If I lived in San Francisco, I would make this my neighborhood place. I miss Cafe Capriccio already and am sad I couldn't bring it with me to the east coast. 

Do yourself a favor and stop by for some breakfast, lunch, or a glass of wine. You won't regret it.
author: Rax P.

description: Pretty terrible for food.  Old, hard bagels are served with super thin and flavorless tomato slices.  The two sandwiches came out to $20 and then they charge $2 extra for hot water.  Avoid at all costs.
author: Max S.

description: Decently priced. Wrap was average. Bagels with lox were a little stiff. Lox was smoked/cooked salmon. It wasn't really traditional lox. I wouldn't go back.
author: Devon T.

description:
We went here for a quick bite/coffee before our trip down to LA in the morning.  We had a http://restaurant.com voucher, and I ordered an oatmeal with fresh fruit (extra charge) and a latte. The oatmeal was nothing too special, but the latte was pretty good.  I always love the unique coffee taste of an independent shop versus the mass produced Starbucks coffee taste.  

The service was pretty quick with the food and drinks.  The place seemed like a chill environment to study, lounge and talk with friends.  

I would probably go back again if lived in the San Fran area.
author: Jack C.

description:
In town for a night before a trip to Napa....This was THE BEST Latte i have ever had!
Such a rich, roasted flavor w perfect foam art...Sit by the window for a little breeze of a crisp morning air   perfect way to start day 
Such a cozy place.  Service was super friendly
author: Beth D.

description:
A very nice cafe to visit on the weekend. Cafe Capriccio is a good place to chat with a friend or get work done from your laptop.

It's a bit out of the way and there is only street parking, which is a bit hard to find in the North Beach neighborhood. The hours are short; the 6pm closing time means I can only come out here on the weekends instead of after work during the week. 

But it's a nice place. Not very large but seating isn't hard to find. A bit noisy from the refrigeration, but the music they play in the background is light and not obnoxious. There are plenty of outlets for laptops and the wifi is reliable.

All in all, I've never regretted a visit to Cafe Capriccio. It's a trek well worth it.
author: Al S.

description:
Saw this super cute cafe and happened to find it on restaurant.com awhile back. Finally went in with it a couple months later and was partially greeted with attitude that they did not accept restaurant.com vouchers anymore and that they stopped the deal. Told them that they should still honor my deal and they begrudgingly did it. Ordered my food and no other words were exchanged.

Panini was meh. No flavor. Cafe vibe was okay that day. 

It was just off-putting in general. Perhaps a bad day to come in. Next time- I'll bring my laptop and order a latte instead.
author: Sally C.

description:
really nice staff, very clean.  but they advertise their coffee as french press, I was thinking I was going to get my own little press pot, and instead they poured it from a big urn ... I couldn't for the life of me see how *that* was a french press.  the coffee was - meh.

Also I noticed that on my $2.55 coffee (more expensive than either Peet's or Starbucks) ... the current sales tax rate in San Francisco is 8.75% which would be 22 cents but they charged me 24 cents which is 9%.  Honest mistake?  I dunno.
author: Alexandra D.

description:
This review only pertains to the panini 

I had the roast beef melt here and it is quite dry. The bread is quite rough which rub the skin off the roof of my mouth. Furthermore, the salad was super sour (which I was not told that It was going to be a sour salad). 

I would definitely come back for the coffee though!
author: Frederick A.

description:
This is a great spot when walking around town with the bf and feeling the need to stop in for a short snack because he forgot to get something to munch on earlier.

Ladies, beware of the man that becomes Grendel on an empty stomach.

Small, cozy, and unpretentious, this is a spot for locals to meander in and grab their cup of liquid caffeine prior to heading out for the daily morning walk.  I requested my usual caffe latte and it came out exceptionally strong.  Not too roomy but for the mid-morning, a good spot on the go.

They also carried pastries but I did not purchase anything as we were to have lunch in North Beach.  Next time, that bran muffin would be mine.
author: Miika M.

description: Got the egg and cheese and smoked salmon breakfast sandwiches. Egg and cheese was pretty basic. Capers on the salmon bagel was good but could have used some more cream cheese. Great place to start off the morning for some quick food.
author: Charles H.

description: Love the outdoor seating here. This place (along with Cafe Francisco) doesn't get a lot of traffic because it's off the beaten path of Columbus St./North Beach territory. They make good coffee, iced/hot tea, cheese, beer, sandwiches, pastries, etc. They also have free wi-fi and friendly service. I have no problem with this place. Even the prices are decent for North Beach food/drinks. It's just a bit small. Oh! And, it has solid background music.
author: Danny C.

description:
Easily a 4 star place but the guy behind the counter was such a dud- I had to drop a star just for that. He just stood there. No greeting, no "Can I help you?"...just awkward silence.
Latte was creamy and smooth, served at a great temperature. Be aware that their small is about half of a tall at Starbucks. That made me happy, perfect amount for me. If you're in the neighborhood, you should def stop by and check this place. Hopefully awkward guy will have a shot of expresso and liven up!
author: Sherry C.

description: Cafe Capriccio has been through so many ownership changes since my last review. The atmosphere and the food have declined so much in quality that even though we live steps from the cafe we never go in, not even for coffee. The last several times we patronized Capriccio it was clear that the turnover of the staff is high. There was never  a manager around. Previous owners were onsite nearly every day. Staff were rude or indifferent. We wonder how they stay in business now. The presence of the San Remo Hotel across the street which does not serve breakfast probably contributes to some of Capriccio's staying power - at least during the early morning hours.
author: Scout F.

description: Excellent chai. Artichoke quiche was decent, although heavy on the olives and mushrooms in the inside. Artichoke slices are only on the top!
author: Linus W.

description:
Nice casual cafe. Beautiful coffee and breakfast treats.  Coffee is proper barista style coffee ( not drip filtered)!
Free wifi and power sockets for charging. 
Relaxed and friendly atmosphere.
author: Josh L.

description: This review is for lunch, which was really quite terrible.  I work in the area, was walking by, checked the Yelp reviews and immediately walked in.  The chicken and bacon salad sounded good so I ordered that.  I was terribly disappointed when it arrived.  The dressing was a disgustingly sweet poppy seed dressing, which didn't go with the salad AT ALL, the bacon was chewy and gross, and the chicken was barely edible.  There were also a couple thin slices of flavorless tomato on the salad.   For over $10, it wasn't worth it at all.  I wouldn't go back.
author: Jen K.

description: Decent coffee (I had a latte). Completely forgettable food. But quick. Maybe a good spot for locals but nothing to bother with if visiting from out of town
author: Doug H.

description:
Here, Cafe Capriccio in 5 glorious phrases:

1. Giant, homey mugs
2. PILLOWS!
3. Password-free, fast Wifi
4. Baristas chatting (maybe about you) in Italian
5. Small but punchy salads

I wish they were open later, so I could enjoy their trendy European tunes and carry my enthusiastic typing into the evening. I seem to be more productive here than in my apartment, the library, yeah! But then again, I'm no serial coffee drinker and the stuff here is strong. Whatevs. Confounding variables of Cafe Capriccio atmosphere and caffeine. They do well fusing the two for me.
author: Cathy H.

description:
I'm not too familiar with San Francisco or the Bay Area but happened to come across Cafe Capriccio and their Yelp offer while I was near the area. The 4.5 star rating and hundreds of reviews, along with a Yelp deal made it a must try for us. 

The cafe itself has an inside and outdoor seating area. Since the inside was packed at 11am on a Monday, we ate outside on the sidewalk. A nice, quiet, comfortable eating area with very few distractions. I could easily have spent a few hours just chit chatting and reading a book. The unisex restroom inside was very clean (important!!!) and the workers behind the counter provided great service. 

The food was also delicious. I got a Caprese panini with a glass of unsweetened ice tea and it hit the spot. The ingredients inside tasted fresh and simple, no unnecessary flavoring. The bread may have been a little too hard for my taste but my friend disagreed with me 100%.

Next time I'm in SF, I'll certainly be coming back! Even without a Yelp deal...
author: Dan Y.

description:
Cafe Capriccio is an enjoyable neighborhood cafe that is within walking distance to both Fisherman's Wharf and Little Italy.  The food is fresh, well prepared, and reasonably priced.  In particular the Caprese Salad and pies are delicious.  You won't be wowed as it is not avant-garde or exceptional food, but you won't feel as if you've had a bad meal.  They occasionally run out of items towards the end of the day as they seems to have a substantial morning rush of tourists.  The service is friendly and efficient.

If you're in the area, I recommend that you stop by and enjoy your espresso as an array of tourists and locals go about their day.
author: Chin C.

description: A small cozy place to grab a quick sandwich or sweet and really good coffee. Fairly priced.
author: Di D.

description:
I was in the area and found this cafe via Yelp. Small, cozy little cafe that serves coffee, lattes, sandwiches, bagels, and such. 

The latte was creamy and strong, just the way I like it. I also had the salmon bagel and that was good as well, but nothing to swoon over. The service was friendly and quick. Parking in front of the cafe was closed for construction, but finding parking around the block was easy and not to far away.
author: Jennifer W.

description: I really like this place, it's small but comfy, friendly staff, espresso drinks are yummy. I still have to come back and try the paninis that look really nice . I had a bagel with cheese and egg and it was perfect .
author: Karen P.

description:
too expensive for mediocre food. 
moreover the waiter was like - tip should be based on non-coupon total.. 
how rude.
author: Jinn C.

description: This has been my goto coffee spot for 2 years and just moved away. I'll miss the friendly service and delicious breakfast sandwiches.
author: Jesse G.

description: Extremely rude customer service! I live right in the neighborhood and have been here from time to time for a coffee or bagel. Today I put in an online lunch order and called to confirm. The woman on the phone was very rude to me the entire time and said they don't use the order service that is on their website. She also informed me that none of the things on their menu online are actually available. This was then followed by her hanging up on me before I got to put in my order. It's sad when a place that is in the neighborhood acts so unneighborly. I will no longer be a customer here in the future.
author: Julie L.

description:
5 star croissants and other quality eats & drinks!  I can't give the place 5 because the prices run a little high to me - but it's a solid 4 for sure.  

CROISSANTS-
you want these - especially first thing in the morning.
Story round here: the owner wakes up at 4am to make sure these are baked fresh by 7am.  

This is probably the 2nd best almond croissant I have had in SF, a good contender for those in Marin County. Without exposing my dirty past here, lets just say that I grew up with mad croissant hook-ups in Sausalito, Mill Valley, Larkspur and San Rafael from establishments that cater to European tourists.  I was an overstuffed child with a mother who thought good parenting meant pimping European butter to me like I was one of her clients. And sadly, I've been bribed with food since I can remember - not naming any names, but I kept secrets for a certain baby sitter in exchange for bags of croissants from a touristy spot in Tiburon.  I hit em hard but I also flipped a great deal.  My point is that I have had my share of croissants and this ish right here is - bomB!  Worth blowing up for.

TAKE EM HOME FOR BRUNCH
My girl sometimes brings them home when we prep brunch.  Anything within a block under $10 that makes me wanna sing, has the potential to become part of me.  I've been good about these until recently.  Your warning: these aren't sweet, but the toasted almond one can produce bad girl affects.  Butter, fingers, lips, hips, swallow, singing in public - "pour some [butta] on mey."  Not sure you wanna hit this.

SCENE
We have been neighbors for almost three years.  This is one of my go-tos to get stuff done because I like that my neighbors pop in and other students hang around to study.  They have wifi, outlets, pillows, and a fair amount of seating.  It can get busy, but I've never had trouble.  The staff is way kicked back even after a spill- I like that.

The music is always crack'n - a few times I have had to whip out Shazam.  I don't know who puts together their playlists but I would probably buy their mixed CD.  

OTHER FOOD & DRINK TIPS - I'LL BE BRIEF
Do get: mocha, latte, cappuccino
DON'T get: regular coffee
Do get: yogurt Parfait, salads, wraps, caprese sandwich, paninis, bagels w/ bacon egg and cheese, vegan donuts, warm baguette w/ nutella, pie, and pastries.
Beer includes Big Daddy, Deschutes' Black Butte (love), Hef, Fat tire, Peroni.  Wine changes.

SPECIAL NOTE:
DON'T get the prosciutto sandwich if you don't like prosciutto - no matter how bomb it looks.  Really, it's a beautiful mountain of raw pig, everyone else is eating it.  However, if that is not your thing - stick to your guns. Pulling prosciutto out of your panini here will get you dirty looks like you're sacreligious.
author: Rayna A.

description:
This is my new favorite coffee shop in North Beach. It's nestled away on side streets, which means that it is normally quiet and has more of a neighborhood-feel than its competitors on the main street corners. The music is just loud enough to be pleasant, with good variety, but not so loud that it intrudes on your conversation or concentration. There is a lot of small-table seating and a plethora of wall outlets, so it is a great place to work. Also, the drinks are excellent. I'm not a coffee drinker, but it's the best soy chai in the neighborhood (outside of an Indian restaurant). No watering down the drinks here!

The only thing keeping this cafe from reaching 5-star status is the food. It's fine, it's decent, but its nothing great. If you need a snack while working or studying, it will do, but I wouldn't make the food the primary reason for coming here.
author: Katie R.

description: The staff at this cafe were very nice. However: this place was a complete disappointment.  They got most aspects of our order wrong and worst of all the espresso drinks were un-drinkable. Much better cappuccinos around the corner at DeLise.
author: Dusty G.

description:
Love this place! Great quality, awesome service, free wifi, and great food. A place for a true European Coffee lover.  I would recommend a cappucino or espresso.  If you are not in a coffee mood, the italian sodas are amazing.  

The proscuitto is cut perfectly and so tasty. The mozzarella is amazingly fresh. 

The one thing I really appreciate about this place is the owner's values.  I had the pleasure of speaking with him once and he places so much value in quality its refreshing.  Take that Starbucks.
author: N S.

description: Ive seen some good pics on yelp and thought i try it out. I came here in the morning. I love mocha's and was really looking forward to see some latte art which they failed Guess its a newbie barista. Anyways I had a mocha and the egg wrap. The mocha and the egg wrap was juz...meh. I should have tried their bagels instead. On the upside it is a Cozy place to do my writing since the atmosphere of the dining area has a warm feel to it plus they have free wifi but again most coffee shops in sf have wifi. Nothing special.
author: Zachary A.

description:
The bf had an early morning meeting at The Cannery so I volunteered to drive him. He insisted on leaving super early and as a result we arrived at 7am for an 8am meeting. 

In desperate need of some caffeine (he woke me up at 5am to drive from Santa Cruz!) I did a quick yelp search for cafe's in the area and landed on cafe capriccio. 

We entered around 7:15 which was right after they open and I was surprised to already see people inside, good sign. 

The bf ordered a chocolate croissant with a mocha and I ordered the breakfast parfait with a plain ol' coffee. These 4 items totaled around $15. 

The guy working seemed more interested in chatting with his coworker than he did interacting with us. He didn't greet us when we walked in, despite looking right at us and hearing me greet him. His disinterest became apparent when he forgot about my coffee and was quite rude when my bf reminded him. It's a shame because the other two guys working there seemed pleasant. 

Anyway, the coffee was fine, the parfait was fine (store bought yogurt and granola) and the bf said that his croissant tasted remarkably like the frozen ones you buy at trader joes. 

Meh. More like 2.5 but rounding to 3.
author: Erin H.

description:
My wife and I stopped here for coffee while in SF for Escape from Alcatraz Triathlon. 
My experience here was limited, but the coffee is truly top-notch.
author: Adam Z.

description: Fantastic service and quaint atmosphere. Very relaxed and quiet to allow you to get a bit of work done on their FREE WIFI!!  Beautiful presentation and quality ingredients.  Try the lunch special pictured below consisting of half salad and cup of soup.  Latte was amazing and cappuccino was exquisite. I will make every effort to return before my trip ends.  Try it for yourself.  You will not be disappointed.  A must try for tourists and locals alike.
author: Amy A.

description:
This is a real neighborhood establishment. Everyone who works here is extremely friendly and they know most every customer by name. 
 
The cappuccinos are a dream and they only use Intelligentsia beans (very high quality).  Expect a little heart or rosetta in the foam. Yum. They're coffee is all french press, meaning it made fresh constantly. There is no decaf (because decaf is for suckers) but they do carry Mighty Leaf herbal teas. 

They have a variety of croissants, including chocolate and almond. I wish they would get them from a better, local purveyor. They're fine but not exceptional like the ones you might get at Four Barrel or local North Beach bakeries.

The food is quite good for cafe-style fare. The sandwiches are hearty and the various entree-sized salads are tasty. You can get basic breakfast foods until 11am, such as bagels, egg wraps and parfaits.  They offer quiche with salad all day (or until they run out). The portions are great.

As of spring 2013 they started a weekend wine-tasting program Thurs-Sun in the evenings. Once they get some better storage for the wine and some higher-end producers, I can really see this taking off. For now it's just an excuse for the locals to grab a glass, sit outside and enjoy the evening. 

Capriccio could make little improvements here and there, but on the whole it is a great little neighborhood cafe with nice people, great coffee and tasty food. I highly suggest stopping in to grab a coffee and chat or to grab a table and partake of the free wi-fi.
author: Regina P.

description:
This cafe is so close to my place that I'm kinda ashamed I didn't hang out here much more often. Although the Starbucks nearby isn't so bad *ambiance wise* really.

The space is kinda tiny and there's really only 1 table where I can look outside. I've tried many of their food/drink: americano, cappuccino, almond croissant, plain croissant, and chai latte. All are really good, although the chai latte is a tad too sweet. Too bad they can't adjust the sweetness other than by reducing the chai powder amount. It's still really good though!

I love the outdoor seating on Chestnut st. Very sunny and don't get too much foot traffic. This city needs more cafe with good outdoor seatings.
author: Novalina N.

description:
While in SF, we walked by this place, and decided to get lunch here.
We only got two things, calamari and a mushroom pizza.  Both were so fresh and delicious. We actually ordered a second pizza because it was so good.
author: Aleks P.

description:
I love this place. I have been going here for a couple years now.

I am a cappuccino lover, I will only go to a few places in the city and this is a winner. 

Out of all the places I go for good espresso this one has the most to offer. They have salads and other yummy fresh-food items, electrical outlets and outdoor seating.


There prices are great, too.
author: S...... p.

description: Awesome little place!!  Best latte ever, awesome Chicken Caesar Wrap & Caprese Pannini and the Mimosa was prepared with a generous amount of champagne!!!
author: Kristin S.

description: Good dirty chai latte, mediocre egg wrap and egg and cheese bagel. Good vibes, nice bathroom. Free wifi! Discount on your birthday :)
author: Anabel B.

description: Came here for breakfast. The ham and cheese croissant was tasty. The latte was yummy and artfully done. :)
author: Jessica M.

description: Ah! What a great latte. They were invariably sold out of the oatmeal every time I came here, but they had nice, fresh pastries from local bakeries to make me feel better about it. And of course, all can be forgiven because of the coffee. Did I say 'what a great latte'? I shall say it again.
author: Maggie S.

description: Use the Yelp check-in discount and enjoy the neighborhood ambience, coffee smells and the warm friendly service. I am an out- of-towner yet have started my last three mornings here.
author: Peter H.

description:
I've been here a couple of times, and I always love the atmosphere. It's very relaxing, and there's free Wi-fi, so it's a great place to study.

BUT ("[someone] once told me that nothing someone says before the word 'but' really counts")

They are quite racist here. My girlfriend ordered a chai latte, and we had to go get it from the counter ourselves. The lady (a different ethnicity than us) at the table adjacent to ours ordered a macchiato... but she got it hand delivered. She also ordered a slice of pie... and got that delivered as well (both by different servers). And she got a heart in it.

Still coming back for the cozy setting, but you'd expect better treatment from a cafe in San Francisco. Guess discrimination never goes out of style.
author: Filmer Y.

description: Cute cafe.  I always grab a coffee and breakfast here before business meetings.  It's a really neighborhood-y spot where everyone knows the people working behind the counter.  I haven't been there for lunch or wine but I will definitely pop in there sometime soon.
author: Kirsten M.

description:
I don't really remember too much about the place... I would have forgotten to write a review if I did not check in here. :P

I think my husband ordered a quiche. 
I saw that people can use free wifi here.
Self-service

Um...that's it.
author: Frannie C.

description: Horrible service. We stood in front of the register for a solid 5-10 minutes with no acknowledgement. When we came to order we were told that literally half the menu was not available. The kitchen looked dirty and most of the tables had dirty plates and cups sitting out. I was hopeful about trying something good here after seeing some of these reviews but quite frankly I don't understand how anyone had a pleasant experience here.
author: Dina B.

description: the manager is nice enough but his staff is incompetent. i've been there three times when francisco cafe was out of bagels. the order: bagel with cream cheese, avocado & salt/pepper. simple enough. yet every time they get it wrong and completely forget the avocado and salt/pepper. it's never been busy when I've been there and it's always the same staff, nobody new. also, $5 for that order is a little steep especially when by the time they get it right the CC is melted on a cold bagel.
author: Emily C.

description:
While day-tripping alone in SFO, super-friendly old woman struck a conversation with me and during the conversation, she advised me to go walk down the hill to north beach and enjoy the best espresso in the city at Capriccio. I am so glad, I checked it out!  One of the best cappuccinos that I ever had! 

It is a cute little neighborhood cafe with a casual ambiance! There is some outdoor seating as well! The indoor seating is cozy and comfy with a homey feeling! They have free wi-fi and a lot of electrical outlets!  

I had a cappuccino and a panini. I wanted to try their baked goods but they ran out of all their pastries...I mean literally every thing by mid-afternoon. So I am assuming that they must be yummy!  Cappuccino, as I said was super yummy. I am satisfied with the vegetarian caprese sandwich too!  The Italian bread was fresh and very tasty.  Even the side salad that came with the sandwich was delicious!  I would definitely go to this cafe next time I am in north beach area!
author: Sree C.

description: Sitting in a nice little bistro table in the sun enjoying my coffee and egg wrap was nice.  Everything was fresh and tasty.
author: Paul S.

description: First of all if you want me to return, you should be friendly!! The girl who helped me was so rude! I had a restaurant.com certificate and she looked at it like it was in another language! I asked about something on the menu and she said rudely, I don't know what your talking about. I ordered a mimosa and then said we don't have those. I ordered a chai latte which tasted good but not hot enough. I also ordered a egg wrap which was just okay. Needless to say I probably won't be using my other certificate I bought for here. Very disappointing experience :(
author: Michelle S.

description: Walking distance from our hotel. Had breakfast here every morning. The quiche was very filling and the coffee was hot and strong!
author: Kelly W.

description: You probably shouldn't come here. It's a real gem and I'd like to keep it all to myself. OK? OK, thanks.
author: Laura L.

description: This place is very mellow. Good for grabbing a cup coffee, glass of wine, sandwich, or breakfast bagel. Staff is very friendly. Free Wi-Fi, tons of outlets, and seating with pillows . Great for some studying or reading/relaxing will be back for sure!
author: Jerry S.

description:
3.5 stars

It's a nice neighborhood cafe with outdoor seating.  I actually like the indoor space - there's the cozy corner bench seatings inside and the large communal table in the front next to the window.  The menu is up above behind the counter with a separate blackboard with wine list.  You can help yourself with water - glasses and pitcher of iced water at the counter at your convenience.  

I wanted to go to a homey cafe for a bottomless cup of coffee since the morning...but one thing led to another and I didn't make it to anywhere.  With the cravings still going strong, I was happy they were still open and still willing to make me a breakfast bagel w/ eggs, cheese and ham.  With limited selection on bagel, I asked if I can have it on toast instead and they were kind enough to accommodate.  

We sat at the communal table facing the mirror - it's a good spot to people watch from the inside.  I had my cup of coffee, the ham, egg, cheese w/ fresh tomato sandwich and hubby had a glass of fresh oj.  The oj was very good, quite sweet.

A man who seems like a regular took a seat at the table and he ordered the caprese salad?  It looked really good with a very generous portion of mixed greens topped with sunflower and pumpkin seeds, raisins, tomato and mozzarella.  

Look forward to returning, staying longer and enjoying some time here.
author: Gloria H.

description: We were in SF from Chicago, and after waiting 20 mins in the Mama's on Washington line, we decided to ditch it for this place. We were not disappointed!! The caprese panini was amazing! I loved it so much that I went back the next day to get another. Will definitely recommend!
author: Brittani M.

description:
(Update)

Yes! Your tasty latte is back!
I will see you often. :)

=================================================
05/31/13
I used to get my latte from this Cafe for years when they were serving it with only organic milk. But a few years ago when the ownership changed, they switched to regular milk and  that was the reason why I stopped being there.

I am not sure the ownership changed once again and they brought back organic milk. I don't know.

If it is back, I will not only add two more stars but also be there every morning!
author: Lady M.

description: Cute cafe! The bagel with lox, tomato, cream cheese, and onion was really good! I like how they made the bagel sandwich neat and manageable instead of stuffing it sky-high or lopsided so that it becomes a huge mess when you try to eat it (that's kind of a pet peeve of mine). The mocha with whipped cream on top was great. Service was great. Sat outside, very nice.
author: Julie W.

description:
Great environment, friendly staff good service. 

The pizza is GREAT, can't go wrong with the calamari, the coffee is good but nothing out of the ordinary. 

Just noticed they are now on OrderAhead, so you can order on your iPhone for pick up and skip the breakfast line - BIG plus.
author: Kuzia M.

description: The guy at the register wasn't very friendly but the cap I ordered made by the guy in the back was great! Like that it wasn't surrounded by so many tourists but probably wouldn't come back unless I had nowhere else to go
author: Jose R.

description:
These guys truly make the best coffee in Nth Beach, possibly even the city! Fellow Aussies: their cappuccino is a perfect 'flat white'.

One teeny weeny gripe, certain staff members can sometimes be less than friendly, and their ordering system (whereby the poor barista often has to do everything) needs work.
author: S B.

description: I had a good latte here. It's tough not to enjoy this place. The cafe is comfortable and makes you want to lounge for awhile. Win.
author: Derek N.

description: Horrible staff!!!!!  Did not acknowledge us until they noticed we had a stroller!!!  Didn't bother to stay!!!!  How did this place receive a 4-star rating?!?!?!
author: Glenn R.
