description: Smoked salmon bagel was delicious and was brought to me quickly after I could finally make my order. The waiter left me waiting at the terrace 15 min after telling me to sit there so he'd come take my order right away. When I stepped back into the restaurant, he seemed to be unwinding, taking his time slowly washing glasses and other dishes.
author: Vincent E.

description:
Definitely one of the better cafes in the area. Nice food, nice outdoor and indoor seating, nice servers.

I planned to get an almond croissant, but the guy in front of me bought the last one, so that was sad. I asked and they said that they wouldn't be making any more that day. Sad again, especially given that it was only noon. 

But I got the granola and it was nice - my friend got a sandwich and also thought it was pretty good. The coffees not only tasted good, but were presented nicely as well.
author: Amanda O.

description: I think I had one of the best mochas I've ever had at this cafe! I also got the egg wrap which was very good and not too small. My wife got the parfait which she really liked and a hazelnut coffee that she said was delicious. Overall I liked this place a lot!
author: Matthew B.

description: Place isn't bad but not the 4.5 stars it's getting. Starting to feel the taste standards in sf are pretty low.  Saw this place on yelp and figured it was within walking distance and got good reviews.  I ordered the chicken panini and the lady friend got some sort of quiche.  Mine was all bread & hummus without much flavor.  Hers was decent but bland.  Didn't seem to be any seasoning and all you could taste were the black olives.  Strange.  I guess this is more of a place for bread and yogurt, and such.  Don't know.  Baffled.  Keep in mind that all of this needs to be taken with a grain of salt as I'm not a big cafe person, which is why it was strange that I'm here in sf.  This place has more cafes than Wisconsin has bars.
author: Pedro L.

description: The female barista is so very sweet and friendly, and she makes a mean cup of chai.  There is plenty of seating and lots of outlets (yay!), perfect for having some coffee and snacks and getting a lot of work done.  And free wi-fi!  Minus a star because the benches/cushions/window looked like it could use some serious dusting/PineSol.
author: Jess H.

description:
Coffee only review: good pouring skills, the cappuccino is good, but the mocha is way too sweet...

They also have a phone QR based system for buy 10 get 1 free! :p
author: Laurent T.

description: Sorry to have to say that my pear salad was drenched in salad dressing which made it very difficult to enjoy, and my turkey sandwich was mostly bread with two petty slices of turkey and two petty slices of avocado.  I guess I really just don't expect to be served food like this.
author: J A.

description:
Alrighty, I'm a total fan. I can't give them 5 stars with the knowledge that their breakfasty sandwiches are so average, but everything else is stellar. 

Their chai tea rivals the Boulange as the best in the city, the pastries are solid and the people that work there are cool and friendly. A bunch of people come and hang out with their laptops or a book and sit in the sun at the tables outside when it's nice. Seating inside is a little limited though. 

One of my favorites in the NB!
author: Eli B.

description: Mocha is pretty good! They make it with the pretty design on top. Their sandwiches and paninis are decent too. Taste very fresh and healthy. I like their smoked salmon bagel. Free wifi, a little hard tk find parking bc hey, its north beach. 3 stars as is. 4 stars if u come w a yelp or restaurant.com deal.
author: Carrie T.

description: A cute little place for either an afternoon leisure or an on-the-go breakfast. I recommend the almond croissant, quite reminiscent of the ones I has in Paris.
author: Lillian Q.

description: Perfect place to come to relax, study or work. Free wifi (need to ask for password), plenty of outlets, cushion settings with pillows. The staff is friendly and provides a welcoming environment.
author: Gary H.

description:
While visiting San Francisco (and starving after a tour of Alcatraz), I used Yelp to find a cafe or bistro nearby to grab lunch. The reviews for Cafe Capriccio were good and although it seemed that most people were fans of the drinks, a lot of mention was made about the food there. Since it was close by, my family and I decided to stop there. 

The cafe looked quite cute on the outside, but when I stepped inside, it felt cramped and dark and muggy. (Granted, it was raining, so perhaps "muggy" isn't the norm there). Other Yelp reviewers mentioned baked goods in their reviews, but the baked good display case looked rather empty.  Seating was extremely limited - I suppose people were working from there since everyone seemed to have a computer.

I ordered a caprese sandwich, which did seem to be fresh and was loaded with mozzarella - but even with fresh basil and pesto on the sandwich, I found it to be really bland and lacking in flavor. The sandwich was served with a side salad of mixed greens rather than chips, which was a nice touch, although the vinaigrette dressing was nothing to write home about. My meal was okay, I suppose, but it was a disappointment after seeing such great reviews and knowing that there were plenty of other outstanding places to eat nearby. 

Everyone else in my family seemed to agree with me - their food was okay, but bland and nothing special.
author: Tiffany T.

description: Worst service ever. Food was all right but there was a lady who clearly should be fired: mean, talking about customers with kitchen people right in front of the customers, not taking orders properly. Can't recommend this place to anyone.
author: Oleg S.

description: Look, there is nothing special here. Well, perhaps they do breakfast better than lunch?  I had lunch here with 6 others.  The employees were nice and efficient, but the place looked a little dumpy, and the food was just okay.  I didn't finish my panini or soup. Certainly not what I expect at 4 star level.
author: Rich M.

description: Free wifi. Great coffee. Great food/well priced. Friendly service. We had breakfast twice during our 4 day stay. Highly recommended.
author: rena s.

description:
I live just around the corner from Capriccio and have been coming here for years. I am happy to say that it is a true neighborhood gem- which is tough in North Beach when you're so close to Fisherman's Wharf and Pier 39. The current staff, especially the baristas, seriously know their coffee. Whether you prefer an espresso drink, or a drip coffee, its all amazing. Nothing beats grabbing a book or magazine and heading to Capriccio on a weekend morning to sit outside on the sidewalk in the sun, drinking a soy latte, and reading. (Inside is good too- the music is always delightful)

Minus one star only because sometimes I come in to read or study, and all the tables are occupied by hipsters on their macs leeching free wi-fi.
author: Selin K.

description: Cafe Capriccio was less than half a block from our hotel, so we had to try it. It was a nice neighborhood cafe. The quiche was my choice and was very good, although a little pricey. The coffee and chai were top notch! I would recommend this place.
author: Jamie T.

description:
Recently came up for a quick 4-day visit to the Bay Area and decided to check this place out because well, my best friend and I were super hungry and Mama's Cafe a few blocks away closed upon our arrival. I don't think I'll quite understand the early closing of cafes in SF. I like to sleep in thank you very much... maybe it's me? Maybe it's a Southern Californian thing? Whatever. Back to Cafe Crap-iccio...

Verdict:
Caprese panini = whatever. Acceptable, edible, satisfying-ish. 
Latte = on point. Really delicious, authentic, fresh espresso and soy milk.
Free wi-fi = yay! Great place to get work and studying done.

Maybe I came in with higher expectations... I don't know. But $11 for mediocre sandwiches and a latte is not where the money's at. You're better off getting a sandwich and coffee at Nordstrom Cafe. At least you'll be able to shop afterwards!
author: Christine R.

description: They would not honor the free item offered fro checking in on Yelp but they make a great Proscuitto Panini and let me camp out and use their free WiFi for about to hours so I can't complain
author: Danielle W.

description: Good food but cashier lady was impatient when we were a bit not sure what kind of coffee we wanted. Not a smart way to treat tourists.
author: David S.

description:
CostCo quality pastry and Folger's level coffee. Real garbage that I couldn't even finish. Listen, everyone has a right to their opinion but, really, if you're giving this place more than one star you're an idiot.

UPDATED 10/22/10: 

Apparently, my review hit a nerve with Yelper, Pamela P., who wrote a compliment to me that read:

"When you write a review about another city's cafe ( capriccio) make sure you understand and research who has the top 10 coffee in the city. you top rated some shitty cafes and probally do serve costco pastries. so please dont act like your shit doesnt stink. and keep your ass in LA."

Okay, first reaction: Must. Stop. Laughing. 

Second reaction: Intuition. I can only assume this "compliment" was written by the management and/or staff defending this dump, which kinda square roots 'pathetic' by a factor of one hundred... plus five. I'm talking PATHETIC here, like the sweaty guys in the back row of the Pussycat Theater (So I've heard).

Third impression: Logic. Pamela, honey, I don't actually have to "research" anything. I paid my money and in return was served a cinnamon bun of sadness and a cup of raw sewage. I now have the right to offer an opinion on the sad state of affairs that operates the business known as Capriccio. 

Fourth impression: Reason, mixed with paternalism. Pammie, my opinion is just as valid as yours, if exponentially sophisticated in comparison, if I don't say so myself. Where was I? Oh, yeah. You wrote the following review of "Cako Bakery" on 1/29/10:

"This place is HORRIBLE!! 
yes it might look "nice" and "welcoming" when you pass by, but there cupcakes suck!
there dry and don't have a lot of good flavor. i was digging the fro-yo place that was there before.
the staff is rude and isnt happy to sell cake! all in all.. something better needs to go in this spot.
k thanks!
:)"

You see what I'm sayin'? Glass houses and all that. What, you never heard of glass houses? It's in the bible. Psych! It's not. 

Fifth impression: Empathy. Think about test driving a spellchecker. 

Sixth impression: Pride. I actually have a pretty nice ass. Really. You should see it sometime.  ;)
author: Avata R.

description:
(Insert usual lament about lack of options when it comes to lunch places around work)

This is such a cute little local cafe!  You will always see people happily working on their laptops, enjoying a coffee, iced tea, or sandwich.  Sometimes this can make it difficult to get a table, but it's good to see it busy!  There is also plenty of seating outdoors if it's a nice day.

My coworkers love the pear salad.  I'm not a salad girl, so I get the roast beef sandwich with cheese.  Oh, it is GOOD.  I also thoroughly enjoy their selection of vegan donuts.  Uh huh, I just wrote vegan donuts.  Try it before you wrinkle your nose!  They have a raspberry one that is yummy, and I feel slightly less guilty eating it because it's vegan, and therefore healthy, and low calorie.  Oh, that's not what vegan means? Whatever.

And the iced tea is SO good. I'm not even big on iced tea and I crave it.  I always add a splenda out of habit but I think I could definitely drink it without.  The service has always been friendly, even when I pout in the rare event that they have run out of iced tea.
author: Mary O.

description: This place is just the spot to go to if your looking for a pleasant environment and great coffee especially the mochas. I also liked the sandwich very fresh and free wifi :)
author: Cecilia G.

description: These little girls came in looking to get a bagel but only had about half the money needed. They still got their bagel.
author: Sean C.

description: If you're looking for good, solid and quick breakfast I this place is definitely worth walking a few blocks from Fishermans Wharf.  Probably at least half the price of the places in the more touristy areas.  We had the bagel sandwiches and the egg wrap, both solid. Perfect start to the day without breaking the bank.
author: Bob R.

description:
One star because the mocha I ordered was tasty.

Otherwise, it was not a great experience.  I ordered a small mocha for the high price of $3.75.  When I received my beverage, it was SO tiny.  I think it was 8 ounces, maybe smaller.  I'm fine with an 8 ounce mocha, but it should have been about dollar less expensive.  The cup was so small that the cardboard sleeve didn't even fit around the cup!  Also, there was no whipped cream.  I thought that would be standard.  

Additionally, the food display cases did not look clean or appetizing, and the guy working the cash register was coughing, sneezing, and wiping his nose on the back of his hand and never washed his hands!  Gross!

I like supporting neighborhood businesses, but this place didn't give me any warm fuzzies about paying a higher price for a good experience.
author: Michelle R.

description: I came here for lunch and it's a cute little cafe. Very tiny, actually. Not sure if I would come here to do work since there is not much space. But for the purpose of sitting down with a friend to chat over a cup of coffee/tea Cafe Capriccio is perfect.
author: Andrew M.

description:
Between the thoughtful service (they take advance calls for orders -- like a pizza place), comfortable seating (padded benches and back pillows), and quality of food/drink I highly recommend this place.

Was originally owned by a wonderful couple but nothing has changed since then :)
author: Chris B.

description:
If you are looking for some great coffee in the North Beach / Washington Square Park area, forget about Cafe Trieste - make your way to Cafe Capriccio !!

Think in terms of Blue Bottle / Ritual here...

The new owners Jesse & Alex, while very young - have put a lot of effort into making sure the espresso drinks are of great quality. Just check out my pics here on Yelp !

Cappuccinos & lattes are made "Blue Bottle" style - with that great micro-foamed steamed milk, with the beans courtesy of Ecco Coffee (Sonoma). The barista in the mornings seems to put a lot of effort into each drink - you may be waiting for a minute longer - but the results - AWESOME.

Food is great too , with huge salads & tasty sandwiches at a great price with huge portions. Decent beer & wine selection.
author: Lisa M.

description:
My favorite cafe in the city, and I think I have been to quite a few.

It is not easy to find good cappuccino in the States -- ask anyone from Continental Europe, let alone Italy. This makes Cafe Cappriccio particularly special. I am talking about coffee, instead of indifferent froth thing with some liquid at the bottom.

This place is also good for breakfast/ lunch. The selection is narrow, but everything they make, they make it good.

The place attracts a number of regulars from the neighborhood, myself included, which I think speaks to its quality. I have seen one bad review, which apparently received a angry private message in response. The original reviewer assumes that this was written by the staff or the owner. However, I can surely say that this place has many loyalists and I would not find it surprising if it was one of us. (Nevertheless, everyone's entitled to their own opinion -- people can read and judge for themselves).

Other features: Great for studying/ working, many power outlets, free and fast wi-fi, quiet, cozy, friendly staff, fast with orders. Too crowded only around lunchtime. However, a bit on the expensive side. Definitely recommended.
author: F K.

description: The service was excellent and so was everything that I ordered! Their soup, panini, and pie is so good. I enjoyed every part of it. I definitely recommend this place to everyone and I will be visiting again very soon :)
author: Alexandria M.

description: Amazingly good fresh ground mocha. Great place to hang out, do some work, and just enjoy the sunny side of the city :)
author: Jayme N.

description:
I used to come here when it was still under the previous ownership. The lunch portion was too small so I didn't come back again until recently I decided to give it a try again even though the new owner has been operating for more than one year. 
I like the present one so much that I came back three times during one week. The barista knows well what he's doing. The chicken caesar salad wrap came with green salad. Very delicious and the portion of the wrap was so big that I had to take half of the wrap home. My husband had tuna salad wrap and it was very good too. A wonderful neighborhood gem.
author: V L.

description:
LOVE THIS PLACE.

We were totally doing the lame tourist thing and had spent a couple of hours wandering around Fisherman's Wharf.  We wanted to find a nice little place away from the CRAZINESS of the wharf to have some wine or some nice coffee, and we stumbled across this place by accident.  It looked really inviting, and there were people sitting outside sipping white wine.  SOLD.  We darted in.

The wine was really reasonably priced, and they had a nice little selection.  $18 for a bottle of chilled, cheap local Chard?  SOLD.  We expected it to taste a little cheap, but it was AWESOME.  Honestly, one of the best cheapo bottles of white I've ever tasted.  We hung out at a sidewalk table, and it was a perfect end to the afternoon.

This place is a gem, and you should check it out if you are in that area and need a nice place to go and relax with a coffee or glass of wine.
author: Kyle M.

description: Decent place to drink coffee and work, but nothing spectacular.
author: Magnus V.

description:
GreatGreat morning spot!  Quality coffee made with care.  They have a nice selection of baked goods, quiches, granola, etc.  Sidewalk seating for those spring and fall mornings. 

Nice wines in the afternoon and eve...this is a perfect little spot to meet a couple of friends and hang out.  Enjoy.
author: Jim K.

description: I mean it was food... I ordered delivery on a Sunday morning and it got here pretty quickly which is a plus. The food itself was really bland. If you don't have any options and are hungry go for it otherwise just keep looking.
author: Jeremiah W.

description: This was was ok. I would actually call it pretty mediocre. I got the cheddar roast beef melt. The sandwich wasn't much, but it contained soo much horseradish I couldn't taste anything and it cleared my sinuses. With that much horseradish, anything could have been on the sandwich and it would taste the same. I also thought the price of this place was a little ridiculous for what it is. So many other sweet lunch spots in North Beach. This was one of my least favorites.
author: Sophia G.

description:
The best coffee !!!!!  The coffee not only tastes fantastic but it looks beautiful as well.
Friendly service, wifi and good chocolate croissants .
author: Susie B.

description: They have a wine bar now! Thursday through Saturday nights from 6-9PM! Buy two flights, get a free cheese plate. I freakin' love this place.
author: Paulina D.

description:
The Cafe Capriccio came recommended to us by a San Francisco local. We had a fairly pleasant experience. 

The Cafe itself has an excellent atmosphere. As advertised by it's sign, free wifi is offered and the Cafe is packed with college students and other working people with their laptops. It had some tables, and some couches, providing a nice experience.

The food was very good, although the menu was not huge. I had the prosciutto panini, which I would definitely recommend. They do serve wine, as well as beer, and coffee. We did not have a coffee ourselves but it looked and smelled absolutely excellent.

The main problem I had was the staff. They were somewhat friendly, but did not seem to have knowledge of the menu. I asked if they were serving breakfast still, and they seemed unsure. I ordered a breakfast item, they checked to see if they had it (they didn't) and so I had to order something else.

However, it is a fun cafe with a great environment (especially if you have work to get done) and good food.
author: Trey C.

description: Cute, quiet coffee shop -- great for getting some work done, or for grabbing a book and relaxing.  Located in a cute residential neighborhood, and also has some outdoor seating.
author: Mel G.

description: I really enjoyed this place. I had a salmon bagel and a mocha. Both were great. The employees were very friendly and helpful.  The outdoor seating was a plus as well. I'll definitely be back the next time I'm in the Fisherman's Wharf area.
author: Bruce P.

description: Best part about San Francisco! great coffee with the cute little foam designs and the croissant sandwich was pretty good as well (can't remember the actual name). This place is absolutely fantastic!
author: Beatriz B.

description: Real barristas. This was a near perfect latte. We went on different days and had different barristas...same quality.
author: J F.

description: I order the salmon bagels that were yummy! they were not joking with the capers. not the BEST bagel ever... orange juice was fresh squeezed as promised. latte was amazing and the oatmeal was quite delicious! over all not bad at all :) and not bad prices either!
author: Lee R.

description:
Ooh, a Yelp first for me. It's a real-time review, yo. As I write, I am sitting in a very comfortable chair in the front corner of Cafe Capriccio. And, of course, this is all made possible by the fact that Cafe Capriccio offers free Wifi (You get two stars for that CC!). 

I've just finished the Roast Beef Chedder Melt (as recommended by what seems to be a very helpful and decently nice staff), I hope the staff doesn't worry that I am judging them, even though I am. They're doing a good job. Handling customers swiftly and with a smile, I have been here for about 45 minutes and they haven't even shot me dirty looks despite the fact that I forgot to put pants on today. (Okay, I didn't really forget. I have dubbed this day "No Pants Friday." Feel free to celebrate with me.)

The crowd is acceptable. No scary people. No crazy people (which is a nice break), There's a baby. But don't worry, the baby is with his parents. It's not like he's just a random baby grabbing a cup of coffee. That would be weird. He has two people taking care of him. Hope they aren't kidnappers. Hmm, better get a closer look. The guy does have a beard, but he seems to be on the up and up.

Ok, so back to my lunch. I gotta say, it wasn't far away from great. The roast beef seemed like it came from my mom's oven instead of a deli freezer. The cheddar was quite melty and the panini bread was crisp, but maybe a little crummy for my tastes. But then, I am a super sloppy eater, and I was destined to get flakes of bread all over my hoodie. So I won't fault CC for that.

I'd love to tell you about the coffee, but I had to walk here, and I am a large man, so I was sweating when I got here. Therefore, I went for the iced coffee, which is pretty good, but isn't one iced coffee the same as all the rest? I say yes.

Wanna talk decor? I do. Hmm I am looking around right now. There is a very large painting of fish swimming around. I do not know what this means in an arty sense. There are some other paintings that make no sense. But they're nice. Then there is a giant painting of a rhino with zebra stripes. I don't know what this means either, but it is kinda cool. I mean, it's better than hanging up paint-by-numbers or your 5-year old nephew's (probably terrible) drawing of his family. They also have those lights that hang down. I don't know what those are called, but they make me feel like I'm in a trendy place. And that is exactly what I want when I am trying to be trendy in North Beach on a Friday.

So let's summarize: Free wifi, good roast beef sandwich, nice staff who don't subscribe to the tyranny of pants, babies with parents, art. So really, I have very few complaints about Cafe Capriccio.

I'll come here again.
author: Dan N.

description: It was ok.  I got my coffee and bagel with less-than-great hummus and managed to eat it.  The lady called me "sweetie" at least ten times and "honey bun" once in a tone of not-so-restrained annoyance.  Not a pleasant experience and not great-tasting either.
author: Natalie W.

description: We went here because the reviews on yelp looked promising. I ordered the ham and cheese croissant and a chia because I'd read good things about both. The person I was with ordered an oatmeal and a hot chocolate. We got our drinks quickly, but they were ridiculously hot and my chia tasted like it had a few shots of espresso in it which wasn't what I thought I was ordering. The ham and cheese croissant was burnt and the oatmeal was kind of bland. The service here leaves something to be desired as they people working that morning were inconsistent in the way the food was delivered. They expected patrons to pick up drinks at the counter, but delivered the food to the table. Overall we won't be going back.
author: Megan P.

description:
I'm actually sitting inside this Cafe as I'm typing this!

I really like this place--it has benches in the back that are comfortable to sit on and allow you to spread your stuff if the cafe isn't busy. They also have pillows, which is a nice touch! The exterior and interior are adorable, and very homey. It's quiet, the workers seem nice, and it wasn't too crowded.

I had a single-shot macchiato and the roasted chicken panini. I'm no ~coffee expert, but the macchiato was delicious, with a cute little leaf pattern on top, and the panini was great--it had a little side salad to it, which was nice. 

PLUS! The most important thing to me--they have free wireless! It's fast and free.
author: Tracey Z.

description: Tried out this place because of the good reviews and the $15 for $10 yelp deal. When I presented the deal to the cashier he looked like he had no idea what I was talking about. Eventually they figured it out and I got the deal but it's always awkward when you feel you're holding up the whole line. My friend had iced tea and a bagel and I had the iced coffee and yogurt parfait, my only complaint was the iced coffee wasn't the greatest but the food was good. There was plenty of outdoor seating and it's a fairly quiet neighborhood so it's a good choice if you're in the North Beach/ Russian Hill area.
author: Hillary H.

description: We wanted to find something for breakfast not too far from Fisherman's Wharf, but also wasn't too touristy or crowded.  Cafe Capriccio had a nice neighborhood/local feel with decent prices. The bagels were fresh, the yogurt parfait had a generous amount of fruit, and the latte was prepared well.
author: Kathy R.

description:
This has turned into my favorite cafe in North Beach.  I think they make the best coffee in the 'hood, and people who REALLY appreciate their coffee seem always to rank it highly.

They have some good sandwiches and excellent vegan fruit pies. You can get a real meal here, not just a pastry snack.  And the staff is super nice.  Free wi-fi!  It's also not in the center of all the hustle and bustle of North Beach, which I really appreciate on a weekend morning.
author: Barbara C.

description: Great cafe for breakfast bagel sandwiches. I'm not sure about the coffee since i don't drink the stuff, although other people seem to enjoy it. I would definitely return for another bagel sandwich.
author: John C.

description: I do not like to be the dissenting voice here.  I yelped this place and had to try it due to the many good reviews.  However, we were disappointed with the food.  We came for breakfast and the food was very average.  Coffee was good.  We had four breakfasts and nothing was above average about it.  There are many cafes in the neighborhood and this does not stand out.  But it is very CUTE!
author: t d.

description:
A+ - friendly staff
A+ - enough outlets for many laptops
A+ - free WiFi
A+ - takes debit/credit cards
A+ - wine while you relax in a comfortable atmosphere

Yay, Capriccio!
author: Ashley K.

description: I am visiting from San Diego and this cafe has the best blueberry muffins i have ever had! The staff is extremely nice!!! Come here if you are ever in the neighborhood!!!
author: Sandra H.

description:
Could be five stars but I think usually grade low. 

My outmeal with fruit breakfast was almost perfect.
author: Gregory D.

description: I've been here a few times, and I tired to really like it because I live so close, but in the end I couldn't force it. I would be ok paying their elevated prices if I was getting the right quality in return, but I haven't had anything that impressive yet. The lox and bagels (my personal breakfast favorite) was exceedingly mediocre and not at all worth the 9 bucks.... I don't think the atmosphere or cafe itself is that impressive either. Maybe I'm missing something, but I'll be sticking to other cafes in the area
author: Taylor C.

description: I love this cafe. It's really cute the service is great! I always get the lattes and chicken or beef panini. This is a good spot if you need some time to study or read a book. They have free wifi and a couple of outlets for your laptop. There's an outdoor seating, so it's also a nice place to have coffee with some friends.
author: V N.

description: Great morning breakfast spot. They have a nice selection of baked goods, quiches, granola, etc.  I got a panini and my friend got the mushroom quiche. Everything was fresh delicious, and affordable. I would recommend this spot if you're looking for a quick bite without breaking the bank.
author: Hiep N.

description:
Down the block from where I work.

Amazing breakfast bagel sandwiches:
I've had the chance to taste: egg+cheese, egg+cheese+ham, and egg+cheese+bacon. Not sure which one is my favorite, but you can choose what kind of bagel you want, (I prefer wheat) and it comes with tomatoes, tastes so good. Coffee is just alright, but it hits the spot when you need your fix in the morning.

All are good choices, can't really go wrong. Very friendly.
author: Jamie C.

description: This is a nice little tucked away cafe. I was looking to kill some time and came upon this place. It's a real cozy environment and has comfortable seating. I ordered a ham & cheese bagel and chai. The chai was one of the best I have ever had! It is a great place to catch a snack and relax. They have wifi there also which came really handy. Overall the business was very clean including the restroom. Priced a little high for what I got but the environment and wifi made up for it.
author: Michael G.

description: Visiting San Francisco for work and found this gem via Yelp. It's cozy with character and the staff are very friendly. I worked on my laptop from 11:00 a.m. - 3:30 p.m. and not once did I ever feel like they were trying to get me out of there. Free wifi, plenty of outlets and amazing lounge/chill music. For eats/drinks, I had a cappuccino, double espresso and prosciutto panini - all were amazing!
author: Amanda R.

description:
I think I have to give this place another star... it's just that good. 

I introduced this hidden gem to one of my good friends and together we came here to work on final projects for school several times. We both fell in love with this place more and more with each visit. The coffee is so amazing! Now, even if I don't stop in to do work, I will stop by just to get a coffee to go... it adds a little bit of sunshine to any type of day that I may be having. 

Definitely recommend the yogurt parfait, the oatmeal, americano, regular coffee or the cafe au lait. So good!
author: Emily S.

description:
I love Cafe Capriccio. It is an adorable little coffee shop that's a bit hidden when compared to all of the coffee shops on Columbus. The seats are comfy, decorated with pillows and magazines are provided to read. This place is a great place to spend a morning sipping on an artsy cappuccino (they put little hearts and pictures in the foam) and eating a granola mixture with milk and fresh cut up strawberries and bananas. Yummmy! They also have sandwiches for lunch but I've never tried them.

For the food and service, this place definitely gets 5 stars. The only reason I gave it 4 stars is because there have been a few times when I needed to get food to go because it was completely packed and because it could be a bit more lit.....But then I might spend hours studying there and they may never get rid of me. 

This place is highly recommended. Oh, and did I mention there's free wifi? A gem!
author: Diana C.

description: The best priced cafe food I've ever seen at a coffee shop.
author: Nicholas E.

description: Horrible experience here! Get to the front of the line only to find out the menu that is clearly stated on the wall is completely inaccurate as they are "selling the business" the woman making coffee is completely rude as she tells the cashier "you don't need to explain it to them". Will NOT be coming back!!
author: Becky M.

description: We had the humus plate with amazing olive tapenade. Can't wait to come back and try the panini's
author: Ramzi M.

description:
First things first - the coffee here is insanely good.  The quality of the espresso has just been cranked up a few notches recently from an already lofty post.  The first few sips especially are creamy coffee heaven.  These guys take their coffee seriously and it shows.

As if that weren't enough, the food is also very tasty with lots of good baked goods and breakfast fare and then an excellent cafe menu of salads, wraps, panini, etc.

And it just keep getting better.  The staff is super friendly and cool, the location is off the beaten path and gets lots of sun on the outside seating.  The inside is cozy on colder/rainier days too.

If you are in the 'hood check it out.  Or even make the special trip - you can hit Trader Joe's nearby on the way home.

Cafe Capriccio is awesome.
author: Tim E.

description:
Why is this place not in Denver?!!?

This is exactly what I am looking for every time I go into another cafe.  Quaint, quiet, wonderful smells, incredibly helpful staff, good food options and the feeling that coffee is to be enjoyed, not slammed in a rush to get your caffeine drip started.

I had a very simple hazelnut latte and the thing just blew me away.  It must have been the quality of the beans, but they were not joking around.  The mug was so big and warm and colorful and they spent the time to make an artistic design in my foam, which is one of my all time favorite things.  In my personal opinion, it is the difference between a place to get coffee, and a cafe.  Way to go staff of Capriccio.

In terms of food, I had the fresh fruit with granola, and it was just that- very fresh fruit with amazing granola.  

If I am back in San Fran anytime soon, it wouldn't be soon enough to get here again.
author: Jenny S.

description:
Everything a cafe should be:  

-  A+ atmosphere
-  A+ coffee
-  A+ food, pastries, and snacks
-  Spacious outdoor seating
-  Free wi-fi
-  A staff who care about the place & are friendly
-  Good hours

Can't ask for much more.
author: Duncan C.

description: Salmon bagel was DELICIOUS. Coffee prepared with care. I like that.
author: Nelvin J.

description:
Spectacular coffee, friendly staff and very good bagels... yes quality bagels in SF!  That alone is reason to go.

But seriously, the coffee rivals everything from Blue Bottle to Ritual.  I think  they use Illy and big props to the Barista - he knows how to make great espresso and lattes.  PLUS he doesn't come across as too cool for school.
author: John S.

description:
We were around the corner staying at the Hyatt looking for a breakfast spot offering more than the typical eggs and bacon.  This place did not disappoint.  Our kids indulged in their yogurt parfait and we also had a bagel w/Roma tomatoes, onions and capers - yum!

All in all, skip the busy breakfast diners and try this place!
author: Brittni P.

description: It's a small, neighborhood cafe. Reminds me of the East Village back home. It was outside of the tourist crowds, so that was good.
author: Jane F.

description: Came here to kill time while doing laundry across the street. Great cappuccinos, pillows, PW-free WiFi. Good alternative to a Starbucks. Oh and I saw they have wine too.
author: Kevin H.

description: Great mocha and good atmosphere.  Found this place when i was in the area.  Needed coffee and a place to sit so i could work (free wifi helped!)
author: Bede D.

description: Ive been here over 4 times now and each time Ive had to wait FOREVER. I realize this is norths beach and tourist central but the other cafes around this area dont seem to go through this same problem. Today I waited to see customers after me getting served (they had simple orders, I had a cappuccino) and finally after i got my cappuccino, it was pretty bad quality. I really liked their lattes here, so thats why i keep coming back, but its not worth it anymore.
author: Sally S.

description:
I still dream about this place!

I don't even know where to begin. We visited Cafe Capriccio during our trip to SF. The reviews seemed good but do not do this place justice! It was so good that we went back two days later. It was so good that I still try to replicate my breakfast there now that I am back home. The ingredients used by that cafe are definitely the fresh of the fresh, the best of the best. My favorite was the breakfast parfait. The hot chocolate was as equally delicious as the fresh squeezed orange juice and the multi-grain toast with the salted cream butter and real strawberry jam were out of this world. 

I'm truly saddened that this place is all the way across the country and that I cannot truly replicate it's deliciousness. Cafe Capriccio is an absolute gem, not just to the neighborhood but to the world of cafes in general. If you are looking for a good cup of coffee (or hot chocolate) and want to accompany it with a delicious yet fresh breakfast, this is your place.
author: Ivonne M.

description:
What a delighful place with delicious food and charming proprietors!

While I'm emabarrassed to say that I am a picky eater, it's not a problem here. They are inventful with their meals and menu, as well as flexible on the fly. They are kind enough to adjust their offerings to suit my tastes and dietary needs. 

I love them and they're right by my office, so it's great for morning meetings and lunch work sessions. 

They make life in North Beach civilized. Oh, and they have free WiFi. How cool is THAT!
author: Irving G.

description:
All you could possibly ask for from a neighborhood cafe:
* A simple and delicious menu
* Ample selection of tables, benches, couches, stools and even outdoor seating
* Free wi-fi with accessible plugs
* Coffee that does not taste like like a franchise
* And my favorite, a wine selection for when you've had enough caffeine or your looking to wind down (not up) with a good read

That last point bumped this place up from 4 to 5 stars in my book.  I plan to make myself a regular here.
author: Ben B.

description:
Solid coffee, as many yelpers have already said. 
The "small" is very tiny. I guess most "real" cafes have very petite smalls-- I apologize, I'm from suburbia where we really only have Starbucks and Tully's...

I've been for coffee and it looked like a nice, friendly cafe so I went for lunch as well. I had the smoked salmon bagel with cream cheese, capers and red onions. Very yummy-- slightly pricey at over $7. 

My boyfriend had their grilled chicken sandwich which he was very pleasantly surprised to find had hummus in it. The perfect addition :) It was $8.50 or so. 

These aren't your everyday deli kinda sandwiches-- if you're looking for a slightly classier version of a deli sandwich, go here. Otherwise, head to Freddie's Sandwiches for cheaper sandos. 

BUT, for great coffee with complimentary wireless, this place is unbeatable! All of their pastries are absolutely delightful and everyone here is really nice. 
Plus, they have books you can browse through-- some true classics and some CA tourism books :)
author: Saori E.

description: We definitely had very tasty mochas there - our favorite of the 3 coffeehouses we tried while in SF.  We didn't explore the menu but the breakfast bagels were yummy and it was a comfy place to enjoy our breakfast.
author: Laura J.

description: Delicious! Panini caprese with a salad and spritz on a warm afternoon. The outdoor tables are fun to sit at and watch SF life before your eyes.
author: Trish B.

description: My latte was the perfect temperature.  The outside seating is nice on a sunny day.  Inside was very busy.
author: Cassandra B.

description: Great neighborhood corner cafe!  I really liked the laid back and friendly atmosphere, the coffee was bold, and my prosciutto panini was super flavorful and delicious.  I especially loved the bread...a local, artisan-made Italian roll.  Everything appeared/tasted fresh and quality.
author: Olivia R.

description:
I honestly don't know why this place has so many good reviews. I only go here when I do laundry and am never happy. Coffee is not great and service stinks. I never feel like they really care if I am there. Let alone acknowledge me or say hi when I walk in. If they are even close to closing (kinda early by the way) up for the day they kick you out or try to rush you.

I'd rather go to any number of the many coffee shops in North Beach.
author: Greg L.

description:
this was my go-to cafe when i was working in the area.

the roast beef & cheddar melt was delicious every time.

delicious coffee and friendly staff.

quiet, relaxing place away from tourists to read a book or do some work.

good memories.
author: Shawn C.

description: You won't find a better cafe in san francisco. The food is fresh with a limited but good offering, the lattes are phenomenal and working from the cafe is pleasant as the whir of the coffee bean grinder, the tap-tap-tap as the grinds are placed into the brewer and then the spit of the foamer becomes a rhythmic background beat. If I could only patron a few places in San Francisco for the rest of my life, this would be one of them.
author: Chris C.

description:
Espresso has definitely improved each time I've visited! Very nice spot to relax or work.  Beautiful decor, and sandwiches/deserts are excellent.

Currently this is my favorite in SF -- meets all my requirements: awesome espresso drinks, dependable wi-fi, and chill (not elevator) music.  I work via laptop 7 days a week, so while the fact that I don't want to listen to punk in a cafe may not be hip -- hey, I do what I gotta do.  There's a time and a place for everything... ;-)
author: Ari M.

description: What a cute little place in North Beach. The interior was so inviting and the Batistas were really friendly. They even offered to bring our coffees to us outside. We ordered a mocha and a cappuccino and while the mocha was really good, the cappuccino was a little over-extracted. Oh well, the ambiance made up for it :)
author: Emily S.

description:
So I have only gone in there for some coffee drinks, but I have to say that this is my favorite coffee shop in the city so far because of how polite, nice, and fast they are.  I have recently gone to some places where you wait 10 minutes for one latte, with rude service, and only one other person in line.
Every time I get my coffee drinks here the lovely blonde woman and the guy making the drinks are very professional and polite.  Not to mention my latte is always delicious and has such a pretty swirly pattern on the foam.  I also like the decor and the comfortable seating arrangements inside.

I wish this place was in my neighborhood!

Update:  Had some delicious cupcakes here after this review.  yum!
author: Muriel D.

description: Has to have the best lattes / chai lattes in the city.  You wont be able to go to starhucks after getting coffee here.  Good froth & not boiling hot so you can drink it right away. Outdoor seating is nice as well.
author: Ted J.

description: It's been a long time since I have had an amazing latte so leaving a review was a must. Silky smooth foam, delicious espresso. I have been back morning and evening for this drink. Their chocolate croissants are also super super delicious and I compare them to some of the other great ones I've had in Morocco and Costa Rica. I wish I had a little café like this near my house. Thanks for enhancing my short holiday from San Diego.
author: Curt B.

description: great ambiance, food is delicious, not heavy or greasy at all, super healthy options and flavour-packed.... quieche egg wrap and chicken panini... winning choices...oh and great cappuccino
author: Rocio G.

description: What can you say about a breakfast place that runs out of Bagel and orange juice before 11 am on a Sunday?? Glad that they didn't run out of the Sunday  morning peace. Glad that they had tables outside and staff that was polite and friendly. But seriously a little bit of planning on the owners part would have made our experience so much better. I'll try to be back, but frankly with so many tempting options around, I doubt it will happen.
author: Bushra S.

description:
This is such a great cafe. I was visiting a friend who lives just up the street from this place. They had great food and such friendly service. 

Great location, great coffee, and free wifi!
author: Alex N.

description:
I discovered this place a few months ago, during my last semester in law school. They are wonderful here. Free wi-fi, delicious coffee, and the food is good too. I recommend the pear and honey salad. The owners are wonderful people, and will let me order just an iced tea and sit here for hours studying. I'd been bouncing around from cafe to cafe in North Beach trying to find a place where I could sit and study, and this place is the best. It isn't too loud, the music is nice, and they don't come around and harass you every hour like some of the other places up on Columbus.

Jesse and Alex are selling the place though in a couple of months, which is sad, but the new owners supposed to be keeping everything the same. 

I highly recommend this place if you're looking for an easy going, relaxed environment to chill, study, get some work done, or just enjoy a delicious cup of coffee or lunch! 

The only downside is that they do close at 6pm... It's not that early, but I'd like it if they remained open a couple more hours in the evening.
author: Mikaela H.

description: Omg, very delicious coffee!! Love the service, love their coffee "design" with the foam. I ordered cappuccino and mocha. It was fascinating (my mom and I can be picky with coffee)
author: Asuka I.

description: This place seems like it's changed hands again. The sandwich menu is the same, but they are using lesser quality ingredients(cheap processed roast beef, for example) and less of them. I ordered the roast beef panini today and it was very disappointing, a shadow of its former self, but the high price was still the same. Coffees are still ok.
author: john m.

description:
nice coffee shop in my neighborhood. The coffee was very good. They know how to foam soy milk perfectly and you'll get some coffee art on your cappuccino or latte.

They carry vegan pies too! Great place to go have a leisurely saturday morning coffee/snack.
author: saurabh S.

description:
I love this place!!!!!!

Came here to study for the first time, and I think I've found a new place to study or hangout.

There's lots of natural sunlight, street parking is easy, and best of all - lots of tables and space to study. oh and I should add, free wifi!

Their coffee and food  are great. Also, they have a great choice of beer and wines.

My favorite parts:
1. outstanding service , great Coffee and Food.
2.lots of natural sunlight ,super clean and  nice location.
3. FREE WIFI is always awesome.
author: Camy P.

description:
Ok, i am lazy and unemployed which are two things that compound each other to last a bit longer then they really need too.  however, i have come up with a few "strategies" which help these problems and one of them involves Cafe Capriccio.

As i live in the Mission and have wireless (borrowed from my neighbor) i decided to find a nice local spot on the other side of the city which forces me to get off my butt and actually refrain from cuddling up with my laptop in bed all day long watching Hulu.

so my criteria is a place which has the following:
quality breakfast tea
cheap breakfast
free wireless (Starbucks wireless is not free)
Bike rack
seating outside 
LOT of outlets.

Well, needless to say Cafe Capriccio has these all in spades.

The breakfast burrito is fresh and made to order while their croissant are actual flaky butter croissants and not the ones you buy from Costco.

so pop on down and say hello as i am the pasty white redheaded guy in the back trying looking for a job while sneaking handfuls of blueberries from under the table.
author: Jai D.

description: I should have written a review of this place along time ago. The staff is super sweet, the ambiance is nice and it is a great refuge from work. They are not uptight about dogs. The honey-pear salad is amazing and the vegan donuts are a great low-guilt dessert. A really good spot to chill out and get some writing/thinking done, at least that's what I do there. Inviting, warm and unpretentious vibe. When it's warm enough to sit outside it is particularly special.
author: Robynne W.

description:
I was surprised.
Nowadays, any jerk on the street can open a coffee house. Usually, they:
-look awful and make lousy coffee.
or...
-look great and make shitty coffee.

So going into Capriccio, my expectations were in check. At a glance the place looked great so I'm thinkin' "heeeerrreeee we go."
To my surprise, my unassuming paper cup was exceedingly decent. Huh.
So I learned my lesson.

This could be a good place to sit and uh drink coffee. You know, there are coffee places that you can't wait to ditch, this is not one of one. In fact if I wasn't on my way out, I would have enjoyed sticking around.
It was busy enough to suggest the coffee is a decent staple of the neighborhood, but not so busy that you have to do the whole circling buzzard routine like at Ritual.

So that's that. Not bad at all. One time that expecting less really did yield a positive return. Huh, who knew?
author: JAYCE B.

description:
I looked in there and thought I would skip it, the coffee couldn't be good.  
I mean, nice enough spot, but I wanted a good coffee.
Later I was invited me for coffee there  .....

Whatever it was, the coffee there some of the best in San Francisco.

I had the capooch...
author: Paul F.

description: I can't say enough nice things about this place. Great coffee, nice staff, good service, not too crowded, free Wi-Fi, loyalty program with free drink after 10 purchases, sidewalk tables. It's everything a neighborhood java joint should be. Way better than 901 Columbus Caffe a few blocks away.
author: B W.

description: You're not too far from Little Italy, but if you care how smooth the frothing of your milk is, how great the barista is, come here. :) It couldn't be any better than any other cafes in north beach.
author: Rika P.

description:
I feel like Matthew R and I were on the "Douchebag-free Tour Of North Beach" last week. I am simply amazed, awed, and dumbstruck by the sheer douche-free nature of the places we went with family from out-of-town. See, my brother and sister-in-law are stoners. Because they're stoners, they didn't want to venture too far from their hotel (in case they wanted to get stoned again) for dinner or breakfast (stoners!). This actually worked out in our favor.

Capriccio is a cute little corner cafe with the usual coffee, espresso and pastries...but wait! There's more! Even a stoner can satisfy those munchies at a place like this. They have omelettes and salads and fresh fruit (yes, it comes with whipped cream, you stoner!). If you, like Matthew and I, are not of the stoner persuasion but indeed fancy yourself a bit of a morning boozer, Capriccio has your hungover ass covered with mimosas, too!

I had the fruit, boy had the lox bagel, and stoned and stoneder had the omelettes and something else. All was delicious and the mimosa had just enough champagne to take the edge off. Prices are great and the service can't be beat. This is truly a neighborhood gem. But don't drive here...just trust me on this.
author: Autumn K.

description: i had a restaurant.com voucher here and ordered the smoked salmon bagel & a chai latte. the smoked salmon had a bit too much cream cheese on it and the salmon slices were thin; the latte was lacking the chai flavor. food was acceptable, but not impressive.
author: Bonnie C.

description:
This is my favorite place to get a cup of mocha!
Their drinks in general have great taste and consistency.
When I had come back from Quebec it was so hard to get used to plain starbucks and peets. Don't get me wrong, I still drink it. But Cafe Crapiccio is what I was looking for. ;P
Their sandwiches are really good. Didn't enjoy their quiches as much.
author: Becky D.

description: My favorite cafe in North Beach! The bagels and coffee are spectacular, magazines are available if you are alone, wifi, and staff is really nice! The only reason for the 4 stars is that the armchairs inside are lopsided and uncomfortable, probably because they are just way too old, but otherwise the place has a good atmosphere.
author: sarah m.

description:
Ive been here a few times. The first, I was with a group of friends from the UK. The drinks took over 20 minutes to get to our table and were prepared one by one, the food took an hour. It was pretty good. 

The other times I have been here the service has been quicker but I have not ordered food again. 

I am boycotting this restaurant as I have heard they treat their staff incredibly poorly and the way the owners conduct themselves behind the counter is far from professional. ( i,e the guy shouting at his wife in front of customers).

I loved the idea of this cafe. So close to where I live, a lovely cute Mediterranean feel, and a menu to make your mouth water. It's just a shame the people that run it are such a disappointment.
author: Amy W.

description: Went here for lunch with two coworkers (even though I'd packed a salad) and I was utterly, totally disappointed. The cafe has a cute exterior, but don't be fooled! The baristas (male baristas = barristers?) were distant and unhelpful. Tea was weak -- I ordered a small and received a cup much larger than the 6-ounce mug I was expecting. My panini was grotty: the bread was crisp, but the fillings were tepid (as though the sandwich hadn't been heated long enough?) and the tomatoes were mealy. Chicken cubes tasted as though they'd been prepared days earlier. Adding insult to injury was the fact that I shelled out $12 for the watery tea and sandwich-mess. Oh, if only I'd stuck with my salad...
author: Kate G.

description: I happily spent an entire afternoon here working away.  Complete with a friendly vibe, good background music, and tasty iced lattes keeping me energized.
author: Job E.

description:
Such a cute cafe with tons of food of all kinds to choose from. Sandwiches are yummy! They also serve alcohol, which is always a plus : )

It gets busy quick and service is somewhat slow.
author: T L.

description:
Coffee shop perfection.

Quintessential San Francisco location. A charming interior, plenty of seating, abundance outlets and free wifi. It was just a bit too cold to sit outside, which made the open window looking out onto the mason/chestnut scene all the more perfect.

Fantastic food. My parfait was loaded with bananas, strawberries, nonfat yogurt and granola (perfect), my latte was nonfat with sugar free vanilla syrup (perfect), and my sandwich needed no customization - chicken, hummus, tomatoes, just how I'd make it (perfect). It came with an unexpected salad - nice touch, and good to know in case you're like me and would have asked for no dressing.

Top notch service. Friendly, attentive, relaxed. In other words, perfect.
author: Jason B.

description: Nice spot to sit outside and do some work or read but I was expecting better food. I had a wrap and salad and neither were too great but overall it's a solid location especially on a sunny day.
author: Rob L.

description: We found this place on Yelp and decided to check it out since we were on the way to Pier 33 for Alcatraz.  Not much to choose from the menu when it comes to breakfast.  I ordered a coffee and breakfast wrap with egg, cheddar cheese and ham.  The coffee was alright.  No big deal.  The wrap was healthy and delicious.  My husband ordered the roast beef panini.  I only took one bite because it was too greasy.  We sat outside to have breaksfast since San Francisco has had amazing weather.  It was probably 60 degrees.  Not one cloud in the sky.  Perfect breakfast weather.  Not much for scenery.  Good to grab something fast on the go.
author: Leslie S.

description:
I am only reviewing the two things I've tried: Chai and butter croissants and ice tea.

And both are fan-freakin'-tastic!  Chai is some of the best every, perfectly frothy and smooth, sugary, but not too sweet, and the perfect temperature!  And the croissants are also fabulous - a lovely pick me up on a Saturday am, but beware - they run out quickly!  Ice Tea is great - although I wish they gave it to me in a bigger glass. Great flavor though.

A lovely neighborhood joint for a cup o' anything on a sunny afternoon.  Oh and they also have such a lovely interior!
author: Erika M.

description: Girl behind the counter needs an attitude adjustment. Slow service, ok food, ok coffee, wifi inconsistent. But don't complain about the wifi to the girl working there because she'll tell you it's working, although it's not, but she'll give you a dose of her attitude and make it a whole ordeal.
author: Elle R.

description: Fantastic cappuccino and espresso. It is the closest good coffee we found to our hotel at Fisherman's wharf- it was definitely worth the walk!
author: James H.

description:
Recently I've needed to find a cozy cafe with free WiFi and after many failed attempts, Cafe Capricco has become my new favorite.

You can sip on a rich cappuccino, enjoy one of their many great paninis or indulge in a sweet treat. The turkey panini is perfect for lunch and comes with a side salad.

It has a relaxed atmosphere and the service is attentive, but not pushy.  I never feel as though I've overstayed my welcome, as you might at other cafes in the area.  And although it's in Northbeach, it's enough off the beaten path of Colombus to cater more toward a local crowd.
author: Lauren T.

description: Amazing: it looks like these guys lived in europe coz they perfectly know the taste of coffee, cappuccino and croissant. Stop goin to starbucks and head here!
author: Matte R.

description: Given the photos of the cappuccinos and great reviews, I had quite high expectations. Unfortunately, Capriccio came in way under the bar. The espresso was badly burned and the milk was scalded.  A cappuccino should not have to sit for 3 minutes in order not to burn your mouth.  I might give it another try (could it have been a one time thing???? I don't know) but would be quite upset if it failed me again.
author: beth b.

description: Stopped in for a latte. Very good coffee. Seemed like a great place to spend some time relaxing
author: Scoot S.

description:
I met a friend here for lunch on Wednesday.  The outside seating looked very inviting and the menu looked even better.  

I had the proscuitto and salame panino and my friend had the roast beef panino.  My sandwich was delicious:  thick proscuitto, yummy salame, mouth-watering fresh mozzarella, red pepper, lettuce, and tomato were on the sandwich.  There was no trace of the portabella mushroom that is listed on the menu, but the sandwich was still good without it.  My friend enjoyed his panino as well.

Less than a week after opening, they're still working out the kinks on the service side (which is to be expected).  Things moved slowly, but we were treated to a piece of cake on the house at the end of our meal.

All in all, a good place to dine outside and enjoy a sunny day.
author: Ashley S.

description: This is a wonderful and quiet cafe that serves really good espresso drinks. I came here on a weekday with high expectations. First off, the cafe has a nice European air about it, with plenty of outside seating. My cappuccino had nice art, good texture and was only a little bit light on the flavor side of things. I asked where they get their beans from, but I think the barista thought I said meat because he told me Boar's Head. I didn't want to press the issue, so I have no idea. Anyway, it's really good. I'll be back again when I want to sit for a nice espresso drink.
author: Erik S.

description:
I used to come here at least once a week when I lived in North Beach.  The guy who works there (maybe he's the owner?) is superduper nice.  They have indoor and outdoor seating.  They serve everything from pastry to coffee to beer and wine.  When I go here, I usually get a chicken panini with roasted veggies and hummus.  It comes with a side salad.
What I love about this cafe is that they offer free Wifi.  What I don't like about this cafe are the flies inside the cafe that land on your food.  Without the flies I would give this spot 4 stars.
author: Sarah F.

description: Capriccio is a nice cafe to grab a latte or breakfast.  Their salmon bagel is pricey, but pretty good.  Their salads are ok.  I'm a fan of their drinks.  A good change of pace from Starbucks.
author: R L.

description:
Okay,
First the good stuff!
Alex and Jessie are two of the nicest people you'll ever meet.
That, combined with all of the delicious dishes that they serve, should be reason enough to go there now. In fact I just got back!

Now the bad stuff...
They are the *new* owners of this cafe, not the *old* owners that people here are complaining about.
That's not really the bad stuff btw, what's bad is that Yelp refuses to take down reviews about the former owners' spousal abuse and poor customer service that don't have anything to do with the great folks that own this cafe now and their business is potentially being harmed by this practice.

Please come by and try the food and drinks here, you'll enjoy yourself and will help right a wrong.
author: Coppertop C.

description: Cute and comfortable for eats and wifi. We spent an entire day here sipping, noshing and surfing. Plus 5 for amenities and -1 for proximity to the next table. Yummy food, drinks and service.
author: Vanessa Y.

description: A refreshing surprise for being so close to such a painfully tacky/touristy part of town. The hummus was "meh", but the pitta chips were very good (seemed home-made). Delicious salad and coffee with nice outside seating. The cappuccino was beautifully crafted and the buffalo Mozzarella made me kinda weak in the knees.
author: Mo A.

description: had a delicious mocha here the other Saturday.... barely sweet, rich chocolate taste, no whip cream offered (bonus) and a great ambiance with ample people watching at street side cafe tables. Outdoor seating is dog friendly (another bonus).
author: Beth P.

description: Very good place with real good food items. I simply had a bagel and coffee (and both were good), but others in my group had the oatmeal and they really enjoyed it. I woulld highly recommend Cafe Capriccio!.
author: Michael W.

description: the neighborhood cafe! Quiet , small, Quaint, great food, great service, best coffee. They  do foam designs on lattes!! skill, mmmm . Definitely a secret cafe I'm not sure why I'm telling you but I love this place so much I should share some of the secret gems in the city
author: Miss B.

description:
My husband and I come here every week. We love the relaxed and quiet atmosphere and the wifi is fantastic! There are also power outlets under the table. My husband gets an Americano which he says is not very impressive but I get the cappuccino or Mocha and LOVE it because they make the milk right! Not that foamy mess I usually get in other cafes in SF. Having said that, we are major coffee snobs. 

The food is very simple but lovely and the service is great, so if you are looking for omellettes and elaborate breakfasts, this place won't satisfy you.

Overally, quiet, friendly, warm, great coffee, simple delicious food, awesome place to get some work done.
author: isis n.

description:
Its really nice and Im here now at Cafe Capriccio now owned by Alex a lady and she is doing this with Jessie her partner. Its really nice and I did not like the original cafe. The food was not good for me - I eat low fat and its more difficult to make plates that are low in fat cause you dont have the advantage of the flavor of meat or cheese so the food has to be naturally fine. This is. They went to Coffee school in Portland and this is good espresso. 
I didnt like the original owners and these people are really nice. I think the original owners had a lot of difficult to get the place open and by time it was they were already planning their exit...

J
author: Judy G.

description:
This is probably my favorite cafe in North Beach. The owners are cool, the wifi is fast - none of that silly zrnet shit, just plain wifi... I work from here pretty often, the place has got a lot more popular with tourists, which kindda turns me off a bit, so I try to avoid it in the breakfast hours now...

Their food is good too, I like the food at Sappore better, but the wifi sucks there. The coffee is decent, you can't expect quality like Ritual or Vivace or Blue Bottle around here, so I'm not overly picky. I care more about the speed and reliability of their wifi than anything else...
author: Andrew N.

description:
Good local corner bakery.  Probably worth hoofing it from Touristman's Wharf hotels and getting something a little more authentic than Starbucks (but then again, if you chose to stay at the Hyatt or the Ramada or whatever, you get what you deserve).  Coffee was great (although they ran out surprisingly fast) and there were a ton of great pastries and sandwiches - I was a pretty big fan of their chocolate croissant.

I feel kind of bad about our stay, though - we got up at 6 AM and were wandering around looking for a place to eat.  Wound up here at 7 sharp and mentioned to the clerk how weird it was to have nothing open early.  The next day, she opened up at 6:30 - but we didn't roll in until almost 8.  Oops!

Great service, great atmosphere, great coffee, great food - it's no wonder it served as our de facto "base of operations" for our stay in the area.  Crowd seemed mostly local, although there were a few stragglers (like us) who were staying at the San Remo.  The free wi-fi was what initially led us there, but the greatness of everything else kept bringing us back.
author: Sid P.

description:
Beautiful ambiance, great staff, and nice music.  I love this cafe so much, I'm thinking about moving to this neighborhood...just to frequent this cafe.  The people that work here greet you with a smile, take your order, and then leave you alone.  Great place to study and get work done. 

Other reasons that earned Cafe Capriccio 5 stars :
+ free wi-fi with a strong signal
+ clean interior
+ outside seating
+ ample plugs for your laptop (inside)
+ wine and beer selection
+ clean bathroom

I didn't eat anything (though the selection is diverse and looks amazing), but I did have the best soy hot chocolate ever.  I strongly recommend this cafe.   If you come, maybe I'll see you there!!

Ciao!
author: Ngozi E.

description: Nice little Cafe with reasonable prices. Try their homemade apricot pie!
author: Tim J.

description: Cafe Capriccio is the best! I am excited each morning to stroll down the block and start my day with the perfect triple mocha with whip. Their customer service is the best and the coffee is strong and persistent. Of all the spots in North Beach, Cafe Capriccio is my favorite find.
author: Erin G.

description: Cappuccino was very good, and the prosciutto panini was excellent. Very fresh Buffalo mozzarella.  I plan on going back here!
author: Gregg K.

description: Best coffee in the neighborhood, and let me tell you, in this neighborhood good coffee is hard to find. Free wi-fi. Nice atmosphere and friendly, non-pretentious staff.
author: Jennifer O.

description:
Great place when the sun is shining - you can people watch as folks walk in and out of the main area of north beach while enjoying the light and some wonderful coffee (or, if you're me, a glass of wine). 

I had the ricotta, fig and prosciutto bruschetta, which was on a really thick, well-toasted piece of bread. It was delicious, although could have used a touch more of the fig jam to offset the heavyness of the pork. But overall it was a lovely meal, especially to just munch and enjoy outdoors. All in all, fantastic atmosphere and tasty food/wine - a must-try.
author: Caitlin W.

description: This morning - 1/12/2012 - honestly got the worst coffee ever - excellent choc croissant though.  Had to stop by a Starbucks to get a proper cup of joe and throw away my $2 cup from this Cafe...that bad!
author: elaine w.

description: Living in North Beach this was my absolute favorite cafe.  Delicious lattes, tasty food and friendly staff.  Loved getting work done here because the seats are comfortable and they have plenty of outlets.  They also outdoor seating which is nice on a sunny day.
author: Carlee S.

description:
Nice people working there and one of the best lattes in the city.  I feel like nobody knows how to make espresso... they can do it at Ritual in the Mission, and they can do it at Cafe Capriccio, though!  They do a fantastic job.  It has that special, smooth, rich taste it is supposed to have but nobody makes it right so it never does.  But Capriccio does!  (And you don't have to deal with the deal-breaking drawbacks of Ritual's atmosphoere.)

The food is fantastic!  I love the caprese sandwich.

They have self-serve water!

They don't play loud, horrible music!

They are super-nice!

They have outdoor seating!

I love this place.  I am gonna cry when they change ownership next month.
author: james b.

description: This place is awesome.  The coffee here is amazing.  Better than that blue bottle crap.  Don't come here so I can find a table to write my fatty yelp reviews.
author: Fatty A.

description: I love this place! The staff is very nice and patient. :) The decoration on the foam of my latte is beautiful, and it is always strong and delicious!  Breakfast bagel sandwich.. Mmmm!
author: Roses A.

description: Poor service, poor bagels, good cappuccino and lattes.
author: Alfio B.

description: Excellent lattes & a good spot for an alternate "office"- free wifi, caffeine, and outlets. I was the only one not using a Mac, so I felt a little dirty, but not so dirty that I won't be back.
author: Johanna S.

description: Great little place to grab some caffeine in the morning. As far as food goes I've only tried the breakfast egg sandwich and it was just ok. The staff was friendly and I'll certainly be going back.
author: Jamie G.

description: Very low-key place to get yourself a coffee, chai or small meal (good salads & sandwiches). Free wifi so great place to, I don't know, job hunt online these days.
author: Abby W.

description: This is one of my favorite coffee places in the city.  I spend most of my time in north beach/russion hill/filmore area.  So, my comparisons are mostly limited to those areas.  For me, Cafe Capriccio is about the atmosphere.  The neighborhood has the right mix of and activity and relaxation and the cafe itself has a great vibe.  I love to kickback outside and just soak in the neighborhood and the sun  (which is surprisingly consistent for SF).
author: Richard B.

description:
Best espresso/latte/mocha I've had at least since Cafe Organica (Grove and Central, circa 2006) was around.  In reality, this is probably even better.  

Yes, I've been to Ritual, Blue Bottle, Fourbarrel since Organica closed.  This place still wins.  

Hooray for badass coffee in the neighborhood!
author: aaron p.

description: So far, I've only had 1 item from this place (the Caprese Panini), but it was very good: tasty & well-presented.  Nice room, too: clean, well-appointed, with outdoor seating as well.  Staff was friendly & overall vibe was pleasant.  I work in Fisherman's Wharf, and I am continually challenged by the lack of decent Lunch places there.  Considering that, Capriccio is a particularly good find.  I will definitely be going back...
author: Eric H.

description:
A nice place for locals. 
The coffee and service are both pretty good; the food is decent.
author: J K.

description: Yes, there is fine coffee in North Beach.  This places rocks.  Their barista is an artist who works hard to make a smooth espresso that is not bitter, burnt, sour, or over priced like most other cafes in North Beach. They use Echo brand coffee.  Soo good.
author: Jan D.

description: Have only tried the salads, but they're great!  Honey Pear Salad was unique enough that I didn't feel like I was at Panera, and the Chicken Bacon Salad was prepared perfectly.
author: Sheri W.

description: We moved to the neighborhoold (same block) 2 months ago.  We are ecstatic to have Caffe Cappriccio on the corner.   This is the closest one gets to espresso in Italy.  Si mangia bene qua, il caffe e' ottimo.
author: antoinette v.

description: A - List. Location. Great Drinks and Food. Comfortable & Friendly. This is a great place to start off the day or meet up with friends later. For a small operation, this is pretty much as good as it gets. Miss this place badly.
author: David H.

description:
Coffee = OK
Proscuitto di Parma Panini = 5 Stars.
Just around the corner = Fantastic.
author: Stryrker S.

description: I came here to study after reading the reviews on Yelp and was not disappointed. There are many tables and wall outlets for laptops. The booths against the wall were very comfortable. It was not noisy. Staff was courteous and the all of the food and the coffee were delicious. The only complaint I have is that the prices are a bit steep. Ordering coffee and food came out to about $12.50 per person.
author: Chris W.

description:
I cannot say enough good things about Cafe Capriccio.

I work within a block of this cafe and I eat there at least 4 times a week.  Everything is homemade and you can taste it.

They use only the freshest ingredients.  If you in for a quick lunch, I wouldn't suggest this place.  The service isn't slow it just takes time to make everything for you right there.

They have great breakfast sandwiches and, I've never had one, but I've been told by a very good friend that the croissants there are better than anywhere but France.  I don't know what that means, but if you like croissants, go here.

They've got a great wine selection, too.

-n
author: Nate B.

description: As good as a cafe gets as far as I'm concerned,.. Very comfortable atmosphere..
author: lee m.

description: Came here for breakfast. The berry pie was really good. I also like the almond croissant. The place was clean and had nice facilities. The coffee was pretty good. Definitely will return here for a good breakfast with friends. Pleasant place to talk and plan a day.
author: Daniel R.

description: Wanted to try a new coffee shop, and the proximity of this place brought me in.  You can tell its a local favorite, we saw a long line of people form behind us just after we came in and it didn't really subside while we were in here.  The espresso drinks we had were really good, definitely get my recommendation on those.  I like the vibe of the place, really homey and mellow.  I wanted to also get a bit to eat, and the quiche looked awesome.  But $7.XX for a slice??  Seems mighty steep, I don't care how good this could have been.  But, maybe some day.
author: William B.

description: My wife and I happened to stumble upon this place while wondering around San Francisco and decided to check it out. It is a nice, comfortable place with indoor/outdoor seating and a very friendly staff. I had the tomato sandwich which contained tomato, red onion, cream cheese and capers on a bagel, and although it sounded a little weird at first it was absolutely delicious. I am not much of a coffee drinker but I did decide to get an iced mocha while I was there which was also very good. Would highly recommend it for breakfast or just to kill some time
author: Timmay S.

description: By far the best coffee in the area. Staff are super sweet. Their sandwhiches are good too. Well done !
author: Mike S.

description:
A wonderful neighborhood cafe located off the beaten path in North Beach.  

I visit a lot of cafes.  A LOT.  This is a true gem.  The best part, they are so awesome and they don't even know it.

No Baristas With Attitude, just great coffee (Ecco Caffe) served on a pristine Nuova Simonelli Aurelia.  Drip coffee was french pressed and stored in airpots.  

I am also glad I got a sandwich.  The food was definitely a good value.  For under 8 bucks, I got a killer Caprese panino.  Bread was from Panorama, the mozzarella was genuine di buffala, the basil was fresh, and the mixed greens were delicious and organic.  

The owners are super sweet, though a little green.  Any mistakes are due to inexperience, and not at all intended.  That, of course, will only disappear with time.
author: Jay V.

description: I love Cafe Capriccio's mochas. Probably never have a better one in my life. I also enjoy their chicken ceaser wrap. Delicious! I try not to go too many days without getting a treat at this wonderful north beach cafe.
author: Marieke V.

description: Neighbourhood gem. Real good coffee. The tomato/cheese bagel I had was very delicious, well balanced with salty capers and sweet red onions. Internet worked very well. Friendly & fast service, pleasant interior and exterior. I am hooked up.
author: Daria G.

description: Very cute! The beef and cheese sandwich was very delicious. The chai is good but too sweet and not spicy enough. Overall I think lunch cost around 11 bucks, so a bit pricey, but tasty and friendly service.
author: jamie d.

description:
very cozy coffee spot
tasty soy latte
small seating area inside and some spots outside too
friendly staff
author: charlotte s.

description:
clean, quiet, free wifi, yummy coffee, a friendly staff that leaves you alone, the occasional dog that visits - what more could you ask for in a neighborhood joint?

ask for their frequent buyer card.
author: T. B.

description: really hungry, it's two blocks from work, and totally happy with my pastries this morning. the croissant was buttery, flaky, and amazing while the blueberry cheese danish was my absolute favorite pastry that i have had in awhile. i loved how i was able to taste each and every fresh blueberry in the danish, it wasn't too sweet, and flaky. Mmmm Need to come back to try some more goodies
author: Abigail W.

description: Love this place. Great Chai Latte, best I've tried in the city. Great cupcakes too.
