author: Justin H.

description: This was my favorite hang out spot while staying in Fisherman's Wharf. The coffee was delicious and I liked that they had good breakfast and lunch options, wine included. I spent most of my time inside reading my book and enjoying the music and free wi-fi, but the outdoor seating is nice too. Great if you want to get away from the chain coffee shops.
author: Brian E.

description:
--Update: 
The owners fight with each other behind the counter.  It's soured me on the whole place.  And I hear they're not nice to their employees.  What a shame.

--Original review:
It really does take AGES to open a new eatery in North Beach, and now that Lisa and Tarek have navigated the treacherous shoals of the Tel-Hi Dwellers, North Beach Association, and the other myriad agencies, groups, and other interested parties, we can all be glad that they have FINALLY opened their doors.

Anyone who lives in the neighborhood has surely walked by the bright red facade of the former flower shop and wondered: When the hell are these people going to open up?!?

Friday, April 27 was their first official, full day of business.  They opened their doors for a few hours on Thursday to give an unannounced preview to friends and neighbors.  Here are my initial impressions:
- Lisa and Tarek are both really lovely, friendly, and welcoming people.  As long as they're in the house, I anticipate a great vibe.  They have worked to be a neighborhood-friendly establishment and plan to host neighborhood events and generally turn their place into our second living room.  
- The menu looks great!  I haven't sampled anything yet, but I'm delighted to see oatmeal as an option for breakfast (anything other than fat-laden pastries, please!), plus a caprese sandwich - a personal favorite.  It's a lengthy menu for a place of its size, so I'm looking forward to trying out the selection.  And the prices looked pretty reasonable.
- Free Wireless.  There's a pay-to-surf station inside, but if you bring your laptop with wireless card, there's free wireless access from the cafe.
- Beautiful south-west orientation for sidewalk seating!  The chairs are comfy and they've done a nice job with the flower boxes.  I predict that you will find me here many an afternoon.  Lisa tells me they'll be open 7 AM to 9 PM, so they'll have a great chance to capture late afternoon and evening business that earlier-closing cafes skip.
- They have Ace apple cider.  Bonus point.

I'll be back to post more once I've had a chance to visit a few more times and try out some of the menu.  For now, it was just a delight to sit at the sidewalk table and drink a free beer and chat with Lisa.
author: Jess S.

description: This place have the best smoke salmon Bagel, it is a nice place to be at in the morning, nice relaxing place to have a nice hot cappuccino.
author: diana l.

description:
i love this place. 
one, its clean. 
two, the seating is very comfortable with pillows. 
three, there are multiple outlets.
four, free wi-fi.
five, love the air work and the ambiance. 

chai latte.... delicious. 
smoked salmon bagel... the bagel is to small for everything in it!
roasted chicken panini... love it with the hummus.

definitely going back there soon!
author: Natalie B.

description: First, I must say that the coffee is pretty good - sometimes, there is a delay in getting the drink, however, the people are really friendly. I do, however, have a bone to pick with whoever ordered those lousy, crumby, dining-hall like cups they use. EEK! I feel like I've just gone to a cafeteria and pumped my coffee into the cup. YIKES, can they please select a different type? I know they got them from Costco, but really. Otherwise, good place!
author: Bey A.

description:
oh, cafe capriccio, how i love thee....let me count the ways:

1. you're almost within spitting distance, if i were one to spit, from my residence
2. your almond torte is no less than divine
3. your hot chocolate isn't too bad, either
4. your husband and wife owners are so very pleasant and lovely, even at the very end of a long day, when the wife half has food stuck in her hair
5. seeing people sitting outside drinking coffee and working on laptops is such a brilliant change from seeing the woman with loofahs in her hair sleeping on the front steps

i'm sure there will be more, but we've just recently become acquainted.

bellisimo.
author: D L.

description: I've been waiting, since I  moved here, to visit this cafe- so I'll say that's 2 years but I could be off by months. It opens! And it's far better than I dreamed! Not exaggerating. OK maybe a tad. I've gone here twice now, and each time was great. We're so spoiled in this part of town- there must be a cafe with a block because damn if I don't need another espresso to keep awake, so I can go back to wine & pasta tonight. What this cafe offers is a slightly European flair from Sapore or 901 Columbus. It also offers an affordable menu of sandwiches and great outside seating on a relatively quiet block for Northern North Beach. Note: twice, my companions compared it to Noe Valley! I kid you not. Glad they finally opened. And the wi-fi is very appreciated.
author: Anna B.

description: Coffee here is quite good, one of the places I like in the area.  There's another cafe around that serves better coffee, but they don't open until 8:30.  If I need a coffee early in the morning, I would come here before work.  Cool staffs.
author: Tim R.

description:
I'm sad. Not only a bad day for the economy, but a bad day for the cafe culture in the Fisherman's Wharf area. I have been going to Cafe Capriccio a few days a week for the past few months and *looked* forward to it everytime.  This cafe had the best food and really felt like a cafe in Europe because of the ambiance and food quality. 

Much to my dismay, I walked in today and was greeted by a new menu and new owners.  The menu had a few of the same items, but overall it was dramatically different. They took a lot of the really great salads (NICOISE) and paninis off the menu and don't appear to have a special of the day which was always tasty.   

Trying to be an optimist, I ordered the Chicken and Bacon salad to go for $8.95.  When I opened it, I was very disappointed to see there was NO BACON.  It was basically iceburg lettuce, tomato and chicken for $8.95. I also bit into a piece of chicken that was crunchy like bone - not a good!

I really hope the owners can make some tweaks and bring back the same food quality of the previous cafe.
author: A T.

description: I've only come to get something to go, so can't comment about the table service. Though it does seem like a nice place to have a leisurely meal or coffee. Whoever helped me, whether it was the owner or staff I don't know, seemed nice enough and happy with their job.  The food is ok. The coffee is kind of bleh. It's weak and the plastic lids have a funky smell to them. Not a rotten smell or anything, but you just get the feeling that they've been sitting around for a little too long.
author: The Sock S.

description: When you are in that dicey tourista section of San Francisco the heart wonders "oh no--just Starbucks!?" But luckily tucked away a bit and a welcomed relief for the tongue.  French Press coffee with the finest of deep bold grounds; I enjoyed an Ethiopian coffee; there was water for a quick hydration.  Nice and friendly and such cute environs.
author: Jaime Patricio M.

description: Cafe Capriccio has an absolutely lovely ambiance with genuinely nice owners who care about their customers (they work the counter and see to your every need), scrumptious paninos (freshest bread and perfect fillings), lots of vegetarian menu options and strong coffee. Oh -- and FREE WIFI. Does it get any better? I just moved to the area and plan to be here a lot.
author: Avital B.

description: Small shop, outside seating, free wifi, but really unreliable signal.  Nice service, good food, and good coffee.
author: Eric W.

description: Cute little coffe shop in North Beach. I like how the place is setup inside and outside. Definitely a great place to hangout with friends or by yourself. Service is very attentive and friendly. Highly recommend it.
author: Leon C.

description: This was the first place I ate when I got to San Francisco.  Minus three stars because my bread was a little too 'chewy' (still can't quite describe it), but plus one star because the folks behind the counter were so nice.  In fact, they still waved at me and said hi whenever I walked by for about a week after my first visit.
author: Nate V.

description:
Any morning that I'm at work, my half hour break is always spent at Capriccio.  Damn fine coffee.  Damn fine.  The staff is comprised of good folks who know how to make good coffee.  The atmosphere is relaxed, but that's not to say it's not always full of people expecting good coffee.  They're busy for a reason.  If I lived in the neighborhood you'd see me in there every morning.

With that said, I've worked across the street from the place for two and a half years now, and I can say from experience that the new management is infinitely improved over the old management.  May as well be a different place.
author: Jesse B.

description:
Cafe Capriccio has the best chai lattes in north beach.  I am pretty sure I have tried all of the other cafes and nothing compares.  In terms of food, the paninis are a little dry but still good, the salads are delicious, the fruit bowls are perfect, and the hot oatmeal is exactly what I am looking for in the mornings.  

Overall, I would recommend Cafe Carpriccio.
author: Angie L.

description: My fav. cafe.  Free wifi, nice people, and a cute interior, where I can sit as long as I like.  The parfait and the caprese sandwich are fabulous everytime!  They keep things simple, and stick with what works.
author: rhiannon g.

description: I was in search of a wifi connection one afternoon when I stumbled upon this place.  And while their internet service wasn't available, I may have enjoyed one of the best mochas I've ever had.  Since it was the afternoon, things were quiet but the girl that was there working was very nice.
author: Matt P.

description: Bravo to the new ownership. I do love the coffee. I was told it was Ecco from Santa Rosa. The muffins and pastries are very good. This is a great place to have lunch as well.
author: Chris N.

description: So, I only come here because its directly across the street from the closest laundromat near me and for the wi-fi. I was so excited when I saw this place being constructed because I liked the awning and how they advertised the promotion of drinking wine during the day. Once I finally experienced it though it was a let down. Ive had one good and reasonably priced pannini but the coffee quality was poor as is the wine selection and salads. 3 stars because its so close to where I live, free Wi-Fi and a cute waitress.
author: peter d.

description: Alex and Jessie have picked up right where Terrick and Lisa left off in giving great food and service in an excellent, relaxing environment. The cafe is bright and open, and they now have extended hours. The new phone number is 415.772.0937, I noticed the Yelp page still has the old one.
author: jeremiah s.

description:
Ten years living in North Beach and that spot is finally something to love. I am still sampling the food to see if I have a favorite, although today I had a Tunisian Salad (in it were egg, beets, artichoke, pickled carrots, and like 10 other things) for the first time and loved it. 
The whole place has a great vibe, whether you're sitting outside in the sunny chairs, or inside at a comfy table. But the owners Tarek and Lisa make the place wonderful and warm. I love how the place attracts a diversity of people--- you'll hear Arabic, French, and Italian spoken there. It's feels so much more like Europe to me than the Disneyland version up on Columbus. 
They are still sorting out the menu and hiring new staff, so bring some patience just in case.
author: L S.

description: Hands down the best place to get espresso north of cafe trieste. The new owners are simply wonderful.
author: brian f.

description:
this place is completely necessary in the culinary desert that is the general fisherman's wharf region.

i dont drink coffee (despite working in a cafe) so i can't speak for their coffee and fancy espresso drinks. but i do eat panini and salads. and they do both of those really well here.

the funny thing is, i hated the real italian panini in italy because they were too simple and usually just contained some processed ham ingredient like speck or proscuitto. and i hate most of the "panini" in the US because its the extreme opposite, stuffed with six cheeses and mayo and every type of meat and vegetable farmed in this country. basically just deluxe subs thrown on a sandwich press. the only type of panini i actually like is the type they have at a lot of little italian cafes in new york, not overstuffed with random non-italian crap but not too plain either.

so i guess thats what this place has, new york italian-american panini. and its served on this soft flattened baguette-like bread that doesnt break your teeth.

the interior is really clean and new looking, and on a sunny day its nice to sit at one of the little outside tables and be far enough away from the wharf to not smell rotting fish in the air.
author: A K S.

description: This place used to be mediocre at best but is now very good under the new ownership. Shame on anyone who goes to the Starbucks around the corner!
author: Howie M.

description: Met with a co-worker at Cafe Capriccio for coffee and breakfast one morning.  Overall,  this place is a really great local coffee shop and I'll be going back.  I ordered a cafe au lait, which was incredible.  I also had an egg white omelette which was pretty good.  The cafe seemed like it had a lot of locals, and it would be an perfect place to study or read a book.
author: Joel F.

description: I wasn't a huge fan of this place previously.  The regular coffee was WEAK, and the service was hit or miss.... Tarek was always very friendly though. I've been a couple of times since the ownership change and the coffee is much better.  I really like french press.  I have yet to try the food but the menu looks great!  The owner is very nice and she really wants to please the customers.  I hope they do well!!!
author: Jocelyn C.

description: We came here every morning for 5 days as we were staying across the street at the lovely San Remo Hotel. The food was always delicious.  I especially enjoyed the Breakfast Parfait with yogurt, granola and fresh fruit. The fruit varied each time and was always very fresh and tasty.  The drip coffee was fine and I was told by my fiend that the espresso was fantastic.  The staff was always very friendly.   The best part was the free wireless.  Perfect for traveling with a laptop.  I would definitely come here again if in the neighborhood.
author: Maika H.

description: free wifi, good sized tables, EXCELLENT espresso, not crazy crowded, and really delicious pear gorgonzola honey salad.
author: Kai R.

description: I have been coming here for over a year, it is great to watch these guys get better and better.  The coffee is organic, something they don't advertise.  Actually, a lot of the food they use is organic, sustainable, or of high quality.  Like the yummy Diestel turkey panino.  This hidden gem is the best coffee in North Beach.  They serve Ecco Caffe, known in coffee circles as one of the best roasters in the country.
author: Counter C.

description:
Alex and Jessie are the new owners and have really set up a great neighborhood cafe with excellent food AND friendly service. The place is nicely decorated, clean and they have tables where you can sit outside too. The food is consistently delicious, hardy portions,  affordable, excellent coffee drinks, cold beer, relaxed and friendly atmosphere, free wifi, dog friendly, amazing happy hour! (3 bucks for a great glass of wine! ) and service with a genuine smile. Alex and Jessie and their staff are some of the nicest people you will meet, even at 7 am in the morning! What more can you want? 
They have a great selection of food , yummy deserts (love  the muffins and  pecan pie). Always fresh.  You can't go wrong with this place.
author: nancy m.

description: Probably one of my favorite places to casually eat in SF. My BF lives down the street so it's the first place we think of when we want a bite - morning or afternoon. The hospitality is unbeatable and the food is incredibly fresh and light. You don't feel like you need to walk around the block a few times after eating there.
author: Debbie M.

description:
exiled to the land of no good coffee, i finally turned to coffeeratings.com for help.

okay, i'm still closer to blue bottle in the ferry building than i am to capriccio, but it's a much nicer walk, and no insane line of tourists to deal with, and the espresso is really quite good.

http://www.coffeeratings.com/review-view.php?ratingId=1127
author: Wangston P.

description:
Really great coffee here--nice and strong. It's a cute place, with a friendly atmosphere and free wi-fi. A lot of the people seem to be regulars. 
I just upgraded them to four stars after having the breakfast parfait. I expected to get a premade blueberry/strawberry layered thing in a plastic cup like most coffeeshops. Instead, she cut up fresh fruit right then, at least five or six different kinds. Delicious, and actually worth $5, unlike other places.
My only complaint? They insist on leaving their front double doors open at all times. I know it's California, but it is 45 degrees out people! Obviously the owner is nice and toasty, wearing a t-shirt behind the counter, and he doesn't seem to notice that all of his customers are still wearing their jackets inside.
I don't think I'll be back until it gets warm out again. Their outdoor seating looks nice and sunny.
author: J S.

description:
What I like:
-great outside seating
-yummy coffee (love it!)
-nice guy behind the counter
-great roast beef sandwich

What I don't like:
-their chai tea. It's the weirdest thing I've ever had. Not at all what you would expect. 
-big screen TV on the wall. It feels tacky and is annoying.
-slightly slow service

What I do:
I choose coffee over chi and sit outside to avoid the TV. Perfect.
author: Mrs H.

description: Everything you could want in a local cafe.  Surprisingly good food.  I had turkey on ciabatta, which was awesome.  My friend had mushroom quiche, which he said was very good.  Free wifi, outdoor seating.  On Sundays, it's just a block away from the new N. Beach farmer's market.
author: Cynthia C.

description: Great place. Owners are awesome, coffee is really top notch.
author: Jon N.

description: Fantastic coffee, one of the bestin northbeach
author: David D.

description: What WAS a super friendly, cozy, wonderful place to get a cup of coffee and relax on any given morning has become just another crap-hole coffee house.  Since new owners took over, it's just not the same - from the loud, obnoxious music  to the rude staff, our Sunday morning coffee ritual will be changing for sure. Huge mistake in the changes, this place will be going under soon. Thanks but no thanks, Cafe Capriccio!
author: Cynthia H.

description: Really great place. The coffee is fantastic, and the barista knows how to make a cappucino that stands up to anything else I've gotten in the city. Sandwich is pretty good, the atmosphere is phenomenal, the wifi is fast, and the folks who work here are very friendly. Highly recommended. Outside seating, too!
author: Eric D.

description: Delicious caprese sandwich (unbelievable bread) came with a tasty side salad.  Great place to sit outside on a nice day.  Latte to go kept me moving up and over Nob Hill.
author: Ross D.

description: I think this is the best place to get a cappuccino or latte in North Beach. Very consistent, very delicious and perfect foam every time. Not that airy, bubbly foam. It's smooth and creamy the way it should be. Only one thing wrong with the place is the owner - the blonde woman (I think it is a husband/wife team) is nice enough, but she's not very warm. I hardly ever see her smile and sometimes in the morning, you want to be greeted with a smile and recognition from your local coffee shop.
author: Lucie F.

description: I have some mixed feelings on this place.....I really like sitting outside here, the street is not as busy as Columbus and you can just chill there for as long as you want.  The food I have had there was quite good, and I like the European feel that the place has.  On the other hand, the guy behind the counter is not very nice.  I've seen him yell at employees and that's kind of awkward...I definitely would not want to work there!  As someone who has worked in the service industry I take that into consideration.  Not cool!
author: Scarlet P.

description: Wow, the warf/north beach actually has civilization.  For this 12 year SF resident, this place is just right.  Macchiato, yes.
author: marc d.

description: New owners are great. Coffee is made by French press and is excellent. Food is very good, too. Best cafe in the area.
author: J R.

description: i have been here a few times, usually just for the drip coffee which is average..i mean, it's drip coffee. if it's not completely watered down i'm going to like it. i did try the nicoise(sp??) salad here which was good, their salami panini wasn't bad,  but didn't exactly rock my world either, the chicken pesto sandwich with goat cheese is pretty tasty. too much bread though..but i'm not much of a sandwich person anyway, and i like paninis with really pressed or thin bread so i can taste the insides. i do really like the employees. they have consistently been very friendly, and attentive. you can tell that they are making a real effort to give you a good experience, so i give em props.
author: Angie B.

description: Finally - the coffee is good, the new owners are friendly, the space looks better and I will start going back to this cute little corner coffee shop in my neighborhood.  The latte I ordered today was only $2.71 and was outstanding.  So happy with the ownership change and the improvements!  I look forward to seeing them grow and improve even more.
author: Robert A.
